Pros:
1. hordes of zombies
2. pretty graphic (for this type of arcade sandbox game from a small studio, I don't expect much but the graphic is surprisingly decent for this one. You can actually see the zombies swaying its arms when trying to catch you. The animation is good.)
3. highly additive 
4. got rpg element (you can lvl up a skill tree) I hope we can have a skill tree for each class too besides the general skill tree that we have now which applies to all classes.
5. combat is intense, impactful and engaging.

Suggestions:
1. Really hope that we can have more customizations for each class. e.g. skill tree, cosmetic, weapon augment etc. for each class.
2. All buff on card & skill tree should be at least 5%, now some of the 1% increase feel kind of useless.  
3. For the "lockdown" card, after it locks a card, that card should still be selectable for that round. Now, after you lock a card, it is gone for that round and you have to wait for next round for it to show up again which is weird.

I'm a gamer for a long time, since the commodore64, and atari days.  Purchased this on a whim.  And probably, the BEST $ spent, and one of the best times i've had with this one.  Started last night at 11pm, didnt leave my PC until 4am.  Awesome game.  Cant wait for what else the devs cook up for this.  Few tips, get to your sos calls, build up the three man team.  Finally, the circle around you is your 'hit-point-distance' ... now get to it.

Good job!
This game is stable unlike any other games. It just doesn't crash. It works. I saw some games crashing even they are 2D, made with major engines like Unity, Unreal, etc. And I cannot be silent about Diablo IV, MW III, they were nightmares and headaches.
I'm telling that those kinds of games are crashing like Hell, often, not just sometimes.
And this game is still an early access! Actually Diablo IV was better than its released version. It just had to stay as an early access.
It's hard to see normal, standard, sane games these days. So many games are crashing, they don't work with controllers, they've got errors, bugs, faults, and they are too many, and they got paid, they keep selling. Oh, how on earth they get money with those products with so many errors!
Even NVIDIA's RTX 4090 flickers, blinks, especially with G-Sync.
Yes, it's a future we dreamed about yesterday, but is it really better than before? Cutting-edge techs, better looking, but they've got so many bugs, errors, faults than before. And it causes crashes. They cost more, they provide more errors. Is this common sense? Is this sane?
Some people said "They are blinded, they are crazy about money." I didn't agree, but now I agree, because I can see this, I saw.
Oh, RTX 4090 flickered again. Gotta turn off that stupid G-Sync again.
Oh, I bought ultimate editions and I haven't played Diablo IV, MW III for long time. It's OK, there are plenty of other games like 'Yet Another Zombie Survivors', they don't give headaches, they don't waste players' life, time, energy, they don't provide many errors, they can be enjoyed, playable, they don't hurt, harm.
super nice game suitable for steamdeck

****WARNING****
!!HIGHLY-ADDICTIVE!!

The pace and excitement, combined with a rewarding skills & abilities system, reminds me of old school arcade games where I lost a-many-a quarter.

This is truly an "Awesome" game.

Easily one of my favorite horde rougelites I've ever played. Extremely fun combat. Meaningful and impactful upgrades, and there a large variety of classes, weapons, maps, and game modes - an impressive amount especially for an early access release.

Starts off simple, and you believe auto aim is not for you, but eventually you learn to force aim by logical movement.  Gets very hectic but slowly cranks it up so doable.  Also keep going, eventually you beef up characters to last longer, give out more damage etc.

Here's what I like: zombies...
Here's what I like more: more zombiieees...
Here's what I like best: 1? 2? 3? Yes!
Its like a variant of those million survivor mobile app games, not worth the time

Overall 8/10

Pros:
+ Very Fast combat, ramps up fairly quickly and you don't feel like a snail like other games
+ Objectives constantly keep you moving around the map
+ level ups are quick and frequent
+ Can have a group up to 3 - each character is unique and adds a lot of combinations to the game play
+ Good amount of bosses - each different from the other and adds a challenge on harder difficulty

Neutral:
* Only 2 maps so far, there will be more but wish there was at least 3
* No story - Just jump right in and that's it. Just a fun shoot everything up game
* Talent tree is pretty basic, but they do help a lot
* Decent metal music, but gets repetitive when theirs only 2 tracks. It does keep you moving though

Negative:
- No base camp or hub after level complete 
- Item chests are pretty basic and only give minor stats, wish their was an epic chest or items that drastically changed the game play loop

Overall:
Great game to kill time in. Start off with one person and ramps up at a very good and fun pace. I really enjoy unlocking new characters and leveling them to see what new abilities they add to the 3 person dynamics. Can't wait to see what they will bring out in the future!

Boring.

Uninteresting upgrades, small boost to stats.
Very little viable build variation.
Great game, highly addictive. More items/weapons per survivor would be cool, I prefer the freedom of Vampire Survivors when it comes to builds.

It's fun but too short.
It needs more maps and some real combos rather than some flat stats.
Addictive as heck, lots of fun!  The 7 released (so far) characters offer alot of ways to achieve objectives.  Reasonably priced, a great 'run the gauntlet' game.
cool game, i enjoy it. i wish they add a online mode, like map is 2x or more size of normal and multi people play in it. that would be sooo fun.
shits really good. addictive like when you mix coca cola with heroin

If you like Vampire Survivors, Halls of Torment, Death Must Die, etc.  You're most likely going to like this.  Some of the badges are a little bit of a grind to get.  There's nothing wrong with that but there's only 2 stages right now and it gets a little monotonous.

 Is it worth the price?  Guess that depends on if you have a little disposable income.  If you only have 1 game you can buy right now...I would wait on this one until there's more here.  I've played 21 hours and I don't really have any interest in doing more "modes" with the same bosses and enemies.  Done a few and it's just kinda...ehhh...Just kinda like all the other Vampire Survivors clones w/o the charm.  I have 70 of the 88 badges and the remaining ones are just for doing the different modes.  I'll definitely come back to this in the future.  Just needs some work.  Didn't see any bugs or frame rate/lag issues and I'm playing on a MSI gaming laptop w:
i7 2.6Ghz  
16gb ram
with an SSD.....
so not the most powerful pc.
sometimes you just want to see how long you can live while killing hordes of zombies. one thing i'd like to see improved is more crazy ragdoll effects

Updated with latest release:

In February 2024 I came back to check on the state of the game and I was very surprised to see they seem to have reversed direction and fixed the issues. Suddenly the game was fun again! Enough for me to enjoy the grind to work out all the achievements! 

Hence I am changing my review back to positive. I will leave the previous reviews below and rewrite for clarity once the game is finished.

The Overview:

This is a very good looking swarm survivor type game. I love the characters and the style (it feels good to play as regular soldiers and the detail on the character models is stunning). The meta progression and the game play are also excellent.

I am not really looking forward to seeing what comes next any more, although they are showing at least three new characters and several new maps coming soon and they are still working on it so I have hopes it might get fixed.

Due to earlier updates, I changed my review from recommended to wait/not recommended, and the recent updates have done nothing except confirm the negative review. The concept is excellent but with each update the game/characters/weapons get massive nerfs! That takes away the fun. e.g. The skill cool down mechanic seemed about spot on so you could get pretty low at end game when you had all meta upgrades (allows time for multiple turrets) - no idea why that needed nerfing. The Critical damage was 250% endgame with meta upgrades, that definitely did not need nerfing.

Now the second map is out, with new enemies and bosses, It is just about impossible to beat on hardcore, despite having all upgrades possible. (I have given up after several attempts)

So far 5/10 wait and see.

The Detail:

Positives:

1. Graphics/Style - The models and style are excellent.

2. Game play - You start by choosing your squad leader from the 6 available so far (some have to be unlocked) and then in the game you rescue survivors to build your squad to 3. Once the squad is full, future rescues give you a bonus level up. Along the way you also get crates dropped and opening these gives you useful upgrades.

3. Game modes - Survive until daybreak for victory - 20 minutes on normal and 10 minutes on hardcore, or chose endless mode and keep fighting until you get overwhelmed.

4. The Characters - The characters with their individual styles feel great to play and their skills match well - So far there are Swat, Tank, Engineer, Archer, Ghost (ninja), and Medic and the runs feel very different depending on who you choose.

5. The Horde - The zombie characters are varied in both their looks and their attacks, and the bosses are all similarly varied.

6. The Map - There are two so far with others promised soon, it looks fantastic and while fairly small for the genre, they are well designed. The first really feels like running around deserted streets at night, albeit a block with no buildings.
 
6. The Progression - The meta progression upgrades are well thought out with enough choice to let you determine your course according to play style, yet enough limitation to keep you hungry for more progression.

Negatives: (Note it is early access and just released so they are fixing these issues all the time)

1. Some Bugs

2. Some Evolutions - Some of the third tier weapons are weaker than their tier 2 so the level up/evolution is frustrating until you unlock a couple of banishes. this is particularly true of the archer who goes from a multi-shot bow to a cold (slow) arrow or exploding arrow, both of which are next to useless and the medic who goes from a rapid firing low damage pistol at tier 1 to a very slow firing lower damage syringe tier 3 and a choice of slow throwing flasks (very low damage cold or low damage poison) - The medic does however have the bonus of improving healing.

3. The achievement - It's Raining Men is ridiculously hard and took hours and many attempts. (might be fixed as they reduced the requirement from 20 to 10, but now there are other impossible achievements)

5. The Maps - There are only 2 and the second is nowhere near as atmospheric as the first.

6. The constant nerfing of everything into the ground, supposedly to seek balance but just spoiling what was a fun game.

7. The political propaganda - the medic has a syringe that says "vaccinate the ones that were too afraid to take the vaccine in time" - while I guess you could take it that you are using the vaccine to kill them, It seems to suggest the Zombies didn't take the vaccine because they were afraid when the truth is, the zombies took the vaccine precisely because THEY were afraid.

I am still looking forward to seeing what comes next and I will update this review if the game gets fixed.

its not at all ironic that this games name is what it is, at the moment it is another run of the mill top down rouge like not unlike vampire survivors or brotato.

it has a slightly unique twist that you enlist the help of up to 3 survivors in total (on a single run) all with unique abilities and weapons, level meta progression of leading characters is a thing.. behoving one to level up other classes in order to bring higher firepower on runs.
each class feels unique although i don't think synergy between classes is much of a priority. each class seemed to work well with each class..... no wrong answers i guess

by the numbers buffs and power ups which everyone has probably seen before 

its fairly well polished at this point and runs well, although very limited content is available at this stage which is fair for early access.

if you are burnt out by the over saturation of top down horde rouge likes on steam you probably wont find much here.
if you want a slightly different top down rouge like you will probably enjoy this game.

I really enjoy this genre, but found a lot of offerings EXTREMELY samey. This on the other hand, feels genuinely innovative with its mechanic of getting to field up to 3 different characters at once. It's a absolute blast to tear through hordes of enemies and try out different builds' synergies. Experimentation is going to be what really sets this game apart from others in the same genre. I'm a huge fan of the surprisingly charming humor in the small tidbits of writing throughout the game too.

The patches do a lot to keep improving the flow and feel of the game and I'm very excited to see what comes in the future. 

My only minor critique is the art, which might just be a limitation of the small team size and having to rely on what I think are a lot of store bought assets that, while fine on their own, dont quite mix here just yet. Granted, this is early access so Im certain a lot of polish is to come. This is really just me nitpicking. If the devs ever want anim or art help, get in touch! haha

It seems this is slowly becoming my new goto game when I want to play something that is a bit "dumb" but still require some quick thinking and is not a snooze fest. To me it's like Skyforce Reloaded, Pinball FX or Horizon Chase Turbo: grindy, but in a good way, and relaxing, it can eventually be played while listening to a podcast or your music of choice.

There are a lot of similar games on the market, but this one catch my eye because the art direction is really good and it has some unique ideas like the squad, and the weapons are fantastic. If you have any doubts about that game, there is a free demo. I am glad I bought this game on EA, and since August 2023, I already played 25+ hours and finished 100% of achievements.

The devs clearly know what they are doing and are using the EA in the right way: they delivered a solid  main game loop that is bug free and well performing. I never had a crash or any slowdown during my playtime. The only thing missing and that is added with each release is more content (maps, squad members), skills, chest items, etc.

The devs do take into account player suggestions: for instance the game was not supposed to be a dual stick shooter (it is using auto-aim and auto-shoot), but since lots of players requested it, they added a dual stick mode. So this EA is also a chance to give feedback.
 
Overall, it always was a lot of fun to play, even with the limited content, and now with release 0.5.1 I totally recommend this game as it is. The patch adds a new squad mate, new items, and more importantly, new soundtracks that are really amazing.

I can't wait for the next patches!

I'm adjusting this review to recommended, but it's still with a caveat and personally I'd give it a middle rating. Nevertheless, here's an edit to follow up after updates / dev response / playing some more, original review underneath.  The time played vs. when review was made is off by like 7 hours because I accidentally left the game running overnight.  In any event, the last update provided some good changes in the right direction in course-correcting, the little goober speedy zombies are less obnoxious and generally speaking the tempo for the first 20 - 25 minutes or so feels a lot better.  It's not quite as aggravating pushing up into the 70's as it had been before.

That said, there's still a very noticeable throttling / clamp on XP once you get into the higher levels and you still wind up at a point where you'll get two levels off of SOS rescues for every one you get off of actual experience.  I sat through almost an hour of endless mode trying to get to level 100 this time around and got murked at 95 -- better than it had been before the update but god that's insanely aggravating because I really don't feel like slogging another hour attempt in a mode that overstays it's welcome.

I can at least recommend the game again for general play for folks bipping by, but devs the XP throttling, while lightened up, is still really unnecessary -- I don't know who's having fun taking so longer to get actual levels later on but it still ain't me.  I'm leaving the remaining achievements on the curb -- feeding the worm 500 kills is just a grind and I have no inclination to ever attempt another > 20 minute mode again at this point.  Here's hoping they can get the sweet spot back, but personally I'm done with the game.

Original review when I'd had enough:

In short - a way overboard XP nerf kneecapped the fun out of a game that was a blast to play before.  

I like/d this game a lot, among this genre that has become my go-to a lot of the time these days, it's broadly speaking one of the better ones with a lot of promise.  For the most part, the direction of updates and polish were on the right track, so it was a good vibe.  There's a lot of good going for this game with its basic tempo, and used to be a lot better at that -- but I write this review having paused the game 45 minutes into an 'endless' run having specifically plowed through as many XP increases as I could get my hands on, reaching > 215% XP modifier, with a 383% XP base from how far into this horde I am... and the dudes are level 65.  

That doesn't mean much in a vacuum, yeah? But it used to be you'd be at that cruising altitude in basically half the time.  The thing is, in arm's length of the same updates to cripple the XP rate in this game they added achievements for hitting 75th and even 100th level in a single run.  

And I'm sat here, 45 minutes into a run with all the upgrades maxed, kiting bosses who are never going to touch me while the occasional random shitter zombie materializes to spawn and immediately chunks my party for from 1/5th to 3/5ths the party's health (which is also gigantic by now at > 2500, with almost capped out armor and damage reduction - and still getting whammied like that by the generic zombies instead of it being a boss giving me a run for my money.)  

I'm sat here wondering what I'm even doing at this point, when the whole hook to this genre of game is A) dependably quick and tidy shots of fast-paced and fun blowing-up-everything-on-the-screen and B) running down achievements -- when at this rate I may as well watch a show on another monitor while I kite more zombies for how long to get those last two?  

Man I get that your goal is trying to keep the game challenging or keep its longevity going, but it was a lot more fun before these recent changes and really sours the bits of good new content that were added recently.  Please, do something about the gollum-looking fast zombie goobers who blend in with the terrain gibbing your team when they spawn being way more dangerous than any boss or elite on the map -- and please, for the love of god, revert the XP change because this is just stupid.

[b][h1]Yet Another Zombie Survivors[/h1][/b]YAZS is probably my favourite bullet-heaven so far, it stands out visually being 3D, it is squad-based which is uncommon and while it isn't particularly content-filled, the developers listen and respond to the players so I have faith in it's future.

[b][h2]Gameplay[/h2][/b]YAZS stands out in being a squad-based bullet-heaven, in each run you can have up to 3 different survivors whose weapons and abilities you can upgrade. There are currently 6 survivors in the game, each of them completely unique from one another.

I love the upgrade system during runs, all survivors have weapons and abilities, weapons can be evolved at max level with a choice of 2 at max rank. Abilities can also be upgraded and its fun to pick and choose survivors that work well together. You can also loot items for certain stats and effects.

There are only 2 maps in the current version of the game, each have different enemies, bosses and events. Given how early into development it is, I am hopeful for a lot more maps. Each map also has 5 total gamemodes.

The meta-progression is fairly light at the moment. You can unlock new abilities for characters by playing with them. You can also upgrade a variety of stats in the skills page, these are currently really easy to max out so I'm hoping for more as the game develops.

[b][h2]Achievements (88/88)[/h2][/b]All items and achievements in this game have video game/media references making it a lot more fun to read through your unlocks. The achievements themselves are fun and challenging, my guide will help you through them.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3006467623
[b][h2]Music/sound[/h2][/b]There are only a couple songs but I do really love what's currently in the game, they're awesome to jam out to while slaying the undead.

[b][h2]Settings/Accessibility/Misc[/h2][/b]A few language options (more on full release). All graphics settings have super useful example pictures. toggleable auto-fire. Manual aim that can be switched between full squad and leader only.

[b][h2]TL;DR[/h2][/b]Early but promising squad-based bullet-heaven, fun to combo different survivors. With 3D visuals standout to the genre. A bunch of gamemodes. Lots of video game/media references. Fun and challenging achievements.

It's a fun bullet hell survival

Its only selling point is that it has zombies, and it's only unique mechanic is that you fight in a group with two of your other survivors. The rest is uninspired and I frankly don't know what they've been doing with their time for the last 6 months.

By uninspired, I mean:

- Skill tree outside of rounds is basic and just provides numerical buffs
- There are only 2 maps
- Items provide either a tiny flat boost to stats, or a stat boost on some trigger. There's no combos or synergy
- Very little build variation
simple yet addicting.... waiting for more levels and upgrades for each characters though
Banish the potato.

While this is a fairly basic bullet hell game in terms of gameplay loop and mechanics, the style really gives it an edge. The title alone gives us some insight to the developers mindset and they're not taking this too seriously.

This gives the game a fun atmosphere while still dripping in horror atmosphere. The gameplay is smooth and the visuals keep me engaged after multiple runs of the same map on different difficulties.

The developers have also been pretty consistent with adding features to enhance the game without throwing off balance or feeling cheap. While certainly parties are definitely more effective, no character feels unnecessary or inferior to others. They all serve a purpose.

With a few more maps and some creative challenges, this game could become an S-Tier bullet hell game. As is, a solid A-Tier.

7.5/10

So the gameplay itself is pretty fun. I'm a fan of hack and slash/survival and I think if you like that stuff you may get some enjoyment out this. Now for the major issues. You're paying 10 dollars for an unfinished game that you can complete in no time. I get it says early access but I feel they are just taking advantage of the terminology at this point. They just did a massive update and released 1 new character. you still have to wait on 2 more and they only have 2 maps. I don't see the game being completed anytime soon because even that took over 6 months to do. So if you are ok with spending 10 dollars on this game and who knows how long for it to complete by all means go for it. If I knew it would take so long to get the content complete I think I would have waited until the game was finished. The game has a demo and that was my selling point but honestly it just feels like you're paying 10 dollars for just an extended demo

This...is...fun...bullet hell auto battler with zombies. it plays similar to vampire survivers and will need to withstand the hord for 20 minutes to win the match. You will pickup powerups and stand near rescuse zones or drop sites to pickup level ups or additional characters. each character has their own skill tree and weaponry specialization. you can only have up to two additional characters added to your party or you can send them to a safe area in exchange for an extra level up. you collect exp and level up with choices for either character specializations or various passives/enhancements. dont expect a lot of variety as this is zombies after all, but the bosses are actually pretty cool with some being pretty challenging. lots of characters to unlock and play with so there is some variety to builds. Graphics: 6/10
•	Visuals are decent but not groundbreaking.
•	Zombie designs are standard, lacking innovation.
•	Environments feel repetitive after a few hours of gameplay.
Controls: 8/10
•	Smooth and responsive, making gameplay engaging.
•	Intuitive layout makes it easy for beginners to pick up.
•	Some minor issues with camera angles during intense action.
Playability: 9.5/10
•	Exceptionally addictive with a great variety of missions and tasks.
•	Excellent balance of difficulty, offering a challenging yet fair experience.
•	Cooperative play is seamless and enhances the fun.
Overall Enjoyment: 9/10
•	Despite average graphics, the game shines in its playability and control.
•	A solid addition to the zombie survival genre, offering hours of entertainment.
•	Highly recommended for fans of action and cooperative gameplay.

The idea of adding characters instead of just weapons is a nice addition to the bullet hell genre, seems like the best bet at the beginning would be the basic weapons and not the abilities.
Would be nice to be able to separate the characters, maybe even have some AI, but that's probably asking too much ^^

Issues and feedback:
You can deduct points after unlocking higher tiers from previous tiers, even if it means you wouldn't have enough to get the next tier upgrade (which you already put points into).
Not clear what does skip do exactly? Just not getting any reward? Does it lower required xp for next? Otherwise there's no reason to pick it...
Why can you banish only 1 item on level up? Also, would be nice if you got something else when banishing a powerup
The no ability achievement counts even something passive as critical hit from hunter... So the question is, with the new passive perks, can you still use them for that challenge?
For crits, it isn't clear what damage type got critical hit since it's the same color for all.
Sadly there are no elemental reactions between different elements.
Both the boss mode and One hit mode don't award anything.
It's not clear whether progression upgrades can  be used for Zero Deaths! while I did, while also getting life steal passives.
Can't turn off auto fire, just says Autom Fire On when pressing the hotkey. Also, why are there multiple movement in actions if you already have 2 options for each.
The 3rd tier for each character requires to kill too many zombies, it just gets boring to farm like that for next upgrades, also too many achievements require you to do them in default mode, it gets boring to wait those 20 mins when you can easily complete it with enough upgrades/unlocks.

This is a well polished game I feel. It just lacks content. 
Levels feel good, the characters all feel different and unique, and I like that it's military for a "Vampire Survivors" style game.

Edit:
The updates are 50/50. The addition to the military training was great, needed a huge buff, and then got it. Altering the buffs from the box are kinda not that good. If you give me +10% damage with weapons, but take 10% from ability damage, then there's the reverse of it...it's not doing anything. Just wasting the box. The only reason it's worth while is because it also gives +5% crit chance, so why not just add the box with +5% crit to weapons or abilities? Or do +10% and -5%? Just doesn't feel good. 

The nerf to main weapons and xp feels bad too. I liked the changes to abilities for the most part and I understand the reasoning, but still, the nerf to some weapons and abilities is kinda lame when others weren't buffed, or if they were you still can't tell...I'm looking dead ass at you grenade launcher. 

Elemental damage is weaksauce...

Capped on upgrades and have been for team. Would be nice to have some more unlocks. Also looking forward to the next characters!

Overall, it's a great game and they seem to listen to the feedback carefully. Definitely worth the price.

Great game, but still a lot of work needed.  I usually don't write long reviews, but I feel there's a good amount to say on this one since it is already a decent game, but has the potential to be one of the greats in its genre.

The current iteration is already a blast.  The way you decide what abilities to combine (adding squad mates) is unique and a fun way to approach the different combinations.   Each squad mate feels unique and fresh.  I would like to see maybe adding a 4th squad mate once the last two are added to the game.

Some characters are still not fully fleshed out and need some balancing work - the elemental aspects also seem bare-bones without much uniqueness (what's the difference between chemical and fire DoT?).

While I like the system where abilities and weapons are two different systems, the balance between the two is way off.  The progression of a squad mate is: level 1-> basic weapon/abilities, level 2-> new weapons, level 3-> new abilities.  This makes for an odd transition since at level 2 you'll always want to go with weapons.

The overall balance between abilities and weapons needs to be reworked, 9/10 times I always go for weapons, because they can be "evolved" (if we're using VS lingo) while abilities can't, they can just be maxed out.  I think this would work if a squad mate had 4 or 5 levels instead of the 3 and each level you could upgrade each ability further.

While the skill tree is fine (it's nothing unique, but adequate), the way power-ups and chests are handled could be better.  Some of the balance is also way off.  For example, +2.5% crit chance is WAY better than +2.5% crit damage, but they are both "common" upgrades.

So that's my main feedback - terrific foray into a genre that has become over-saturated since Vampire Survivors hit it big,

This game is as addictive as the grandfather of reverse bullet hells "vampire survivors". Its similar enough that your strategies youve learned will carry over while being different enough to warrant playing it. There are obviously similarities like items and leveling but theres new things like temporary power ups, classes and abilities, training passives, survivor rescues and more. The sound design is really good, the weapons sound good and the u.i. chimes for power ups are dopamine tinglers. The u.i. in general is great, for such a hectic game you really have a clear view of all the necessary information to plan ahead. The graphics are really good for a top down especially the visceral feedback of killin zombies. There a lot of classes and abilities, a decent but not impressive amount of enemy variert but only 2 maps though so we are all waiting for more content. But Ive gotten 5 fun hours for less than 10$ and hopefully more on the way, so its a good game to get cheap and early and revisit from time to time.

Gets very stale and boring fast. Such a mediocre survivors/bullet heaven game.

- Grind based challenge. Not that much movement or strat based challenge.
- Overpowered weapons/passives/skills are locked behind a grind wall.
- Very unbalanced; weapon builds are the best in the game, skills suck late game.
- Because weapons are overpowered and meta, every tier 3 weapon has only one viable choice. 
- Because skills suck, some characters are literally one viable weapon and passive characters. This also makes some characters unviable eg. medic, which becomes useless after you upgrade hp regen in the skill tree.
- Lackluster enemy designs. They're zombies which you've seen before alright.
- Gameplay is mainly about moving around the map while you brainlessly pick weapon and crit related pick ups.
- Hitboxes are wonky so careful skill based movement is hard. Sometimes you think you won't get hit, you'll get hit.
- One shot giants bosses can one shot kill you out of screen because you can't see their charge indicator because of the visual clutter.

-/+ Kinda doesn't matter whether you go weapon or elemental meta builds. In the end they feel the same because you'll end up running around the map.

+ Team based gameplay and builds are cool.

Wouldn't recommend this game in its current state. Wait for updates. There's plenty better and more fun games in the genre out there.

So we all know vampire survivors wasn't the first game on its genre ofc. But it is without a doubt the most successful. Only reason I'm starting this sentence is because; yes i will compare this game to vampire survivors.

Pros IMO;
First things first, for its genre, the graphics and the style is absolutely top. It sinks you into the game for sure. There is an upgrade tree with your classic stats like more exp, more pull, more hp, more hp regen so on so on. Maps are not unlimited, BUT for sure big enough.  UI is nice and simple. Sounds are satisfying. (this was very important for me personally) You will get your hour for buck if you are into this genre of games. Characters are interesting enough visually. I also really like that zombies drop limited boosters. I like that the game keeps you actively walking around the map as well.

Cons IMO; 
I'm aware its an early access game but, i think some of the characters -as far as the skills/weapons go- feel so unfinished. You know how you get that nirvana satisfaction feeling in vampire survivors at some point of your run, where u walk through enemies and it feels like you are being rewarded by the god himself? I never really hit that feeling in this game UNLESS i played 2 specific characters with specific weapons and upgrades. [spoiler]swat:AR - tank: Minigun with crit-attack speed build. Third survivor doesn't even matter. And it sucks if i choose to use rocket launcher or sniper rifle, i will not experience a satisfying game play.[/spoiler] I feel like vampire survivors does this part really good. Even having so many characters and weapons to play with in vampire survivors, they still manage to make it satisfying at some point of your run. The skills in this game are also nice and creative BUT sadly except a couple of em, they are also very unsatisfying to pick or play with. (Grenades mostly... Don't even see them visually.)
ANYWAY, again, i am aware it is an early access game and that there is so much room for improvement AND i do hope they improve and continue developing this game. It has so much potential...

When me and my hubby first tried the game on the demo version, the game started a bit slow and boring for about 1 hour. Then it got better and more interesting over the 3 hours we sank into the demo. And we decided to buy the game. so far 25+3 hours play time and we are still actively playing (so many achievements to unlock). Overall worth our money, fun game, good visuals, good sounds, just missing a bit of oomph with the weapons and skills. 
(paid version is much more polished than the demo version but def. give it a go)

Super fun game. Graphics are nice, mixing and matching survivors and different unlockable weapons and abilities is well done and the layers of permanent upgrades are useful and rewarding. 

Great title to break up the monotony of burning through other long investment games, especially for so cheap. Seems to have steady updates with fixes and content as well.

Runs smoothly, no bugs or crashes yet, controller and ultra wide supported.
Pretty addicting. Its got some cool leveling and alot of characters to chose from. 100% dl it on the steam deck

This is my favorite Survivor-like so far. Its on the opposite end of design from Brotato in terms of build complexity.
'Do one of my weapons have lots of single-target DPS? Do I have a medium amount of AOE damage? Okay. The build is viable.'
That's it. I don't play this genre to be challenged. I play it to veg out and fuck zombies up. The weapons look and sound good. The abilities feel impactful. The meta-progression doesn't take long too ramp up.
So simple in concept and so well executed in practise. My go-to game for just whiling the hours away

In short, the game is fun.
But still, I can't recommend this game because:
[list]
    [*]it's overpriced. The game has at best $5 worth of content, not $10.
    [*]the development is very slow. I played this game in September. Then I played it in January and since then the devs only added one new character and a new perk system, which feels like a very minor change
[/list]
Uncomplicated extreme violent fun!

From what I've played a fun survivor game. Can't wait to dig further into it. Been having a blast so far.

Pretty dope entry in the survivors genre. Easily my favourite in terms of visuals and gameplay, yet its still lacking content heavily.

+Immersive setting and choice of gear as well as gadgets
+Very pleasing camera angle, movement and gunplay
+The "3 char" squad gameplay, in which every char aims and works kinda on his own but still hitting the teamwork is absolutely FIRE. Love that!
+Hitting and dealing damage has lots of weight to it, very satisfying
+Bosses look really good
+Ragdoll anis on basic mobs <3
+Many QoL aspects that are kinda obligatory for this genre are already there which is amazing (ex aimbotting)
+Unlocking new weapons and perks on chars is VERY motivating and got huge impact
+I like the mission system with various objectives and the progression bound to it, thats cool!

+- The soundtrack in the lobby and basic city mission is top quality, absolutely amazing. All the other tracks are generic and dull tho. So going with a 50/50 here.

-Lacking content in pretty much any aspect, need to build onto that!
 Enemies   More Missions    Enemy and Boss variety     More maps     More chars    More lvl up upgrades
-abilities feel for the most part kinda useless rn, stacking all into guns is the way to go
-for some reason the tank has more dps and impact than like nearly every other class which feels weird
-the difficulty in 90% of modes isnt dodging our outscaling huge waves or bosses but being suddenly oneshot because mob damage seems to scale up like crazy the longer the mission goes on


Overall a very promising game so far, hoping for solid changes and lots of content additions. Definitely having much fun with it so far, feeling polished and quality rich. Just lacks content variety.

I am loving this game. There is loads of variety and great characters. So far they each feel very different and I cant wait to see what else they have cooking up. Not to mention the overall look of the game is fantastic. I strongly suggest people give this game a try. I picked it on sale but I would have happily paid full price and still felt like my money was well spent. 
Thank you to everyone putting in the hard work day to day. Its great to get such a quality games these days.

This is one of the best bullet hell games out there. I own many of them and i have tried almost all of them at some point. I really enjoyed this one even in early access. If you liked Vampire Survivors and would like another one, this is a great pick. It has many good ideas like having a party of up to 3 characters. I also liked the gritty, realistic setting. It also runs suprisingly well on my machine, an Intel Core i5 11500 with its integrated gpu (UHD 750) and 32gb of 3200mhz ddr4 ram. I am running Linux and played with Proton Experimental. While the game is demanding, if you lower the settings at the minimum you can play it just fine with no bugs, crushes, or performance issues. Definitely recommended.

I was playing this game for the first time with the game prior to the release of Pyro. When I was two achievements away from 100% the game the new update came through. The update was a welcome relief, yes they made changes to XP, weapons, abilities, and elements. They also made the game feel truly, "endless". I did 100% the game in about 35 hours of game play, though after 100% the game, I noticed that I came back to it. Though it does not have a "story" like "Hades" this is still a great game to chill out to and game. I am super excited about seeing where this game goes and the new characters and levels that are coming down the line. In my personal opinion this game has the potential to rival "Hades" and "Vampire Survivor". 

To the developers,
As a side note, I have been gaming since I was child, I am now 39 years old. My 12 year old loves this game as well. My son did say that he would like to see a character like "chemical engineer" a playable character that only has elemental damage but you have to choose one of three branches, fire, ice, or chemical. As well as have a stage that has "ramps" to offer "high ground". I admit that I am not a game developer so I don't know how hard it would be to add things like I mentioned above.

I have 15 hours in this game so far and I fully expect this to keep increase. This game is absolutely wonderful. I really enjoy the "vampire survivor" style games and this one fits that niche extremely well. 

Pros:
- The combat loop is a ton of fun which is a mix of brotato and vampire survivors
- Combining three "survivors" into your team can make some interesting synergies (sniper for one, aoe explosive bows, gattling gun)
- Playing a survivor for longer means you can get access to fun abilities
- While I think the most recent patch (.50) went back in some ways it's clear the dev is interested in trying new things and there is passion in the work
- The soundtrack absolutely slaps

Cons
- No synergies on abilities. One of my favorite thing in these games is combing abilities or working with other abilities to awesome effect thus getting that feeling of being powerful. Dev said it's coming but it's not here yet
- XP got nerfed thus mandating that you banish many abilities that could be fun so that you can get all your weapons to max level. Reduces build diversity
- Too many useless items. 1% damage? Not worth it
Fun stuff, updates are great
Needs a lot of balancing work. Will return later in development.
Superb! If you like Vampire Survivors and/or Halls of Torment, this game is one you definitely want to check out.

Picked this game up on sale - discounted off of its already cheap price. I was not disappointed.

At first I thought this was the typical 'run around and see how long you can survive' zombie game. I was pleased to discover that I was mistaken.

A variety of characters, each with their own weapons, rank-ups, special abilities, and skills. Characters to unlock as well. There are different maps that present new zombies and environmental challenges. Tired of the typical survive 20 minutes game mode? No problem! There are others to try as well.

For the price, on sale or not, you won't be sorry you picked up this little gem. It's simple, yet has enough variety that kept me playing to see what else I could unlock and see which combination of characters worked the best together. A fun little game to burn time and not get sucked into a story line or say 'just one more turn'.
Its Hades and Vampire Survivor put together....but with guns.  Another addicting game I'll be playing for a long while ^_^'

First and foremost, this game has a demo...  That in itself is worthy of praise.  Games willing to let players test it out before buying show how much confidence they have in their game.  I played the demo for half an hour and had a blast, quite literally.  The game is a slow build into utter chaos and its enjoyable the entire way.  

The purchased version adds many more bells and whistles to the game, which make it even better. The various characters each add their own unique play strategy and the power up names are always good for a chuckle. 

Its also a great pick up and put down game for those who have busy schedules.  Its doubtful I know, but I do wish that the game could get a co-op in the future.  I enjoy playing games like this with my kids when I find them, but that aside I highly recommend this game if its your jam.  I'm looking forward to the many levels ive yet to test.   Great work Devs!

this is how you do a Vampire Survivors type game right. I can't stand zombie games usually because I find the whole setting odious. so I'd not play this if it wasn't exceedingly well done.

it does all the good things and none of the BS that a lot of people try to shove into the genre: 

all the weapons auto aim
upgrades and powerups galore
no dodging, no dodge fest simulator - you live and die by the upgrades you get and how well you path through the mobs as it should be

the game also has a nice new mechanic with you choosing the members of the team, thus pre-choosing the possible weapons and upgrades.
it makes the game fresh but also familiar
lots of different monsters/zombies, weapon effects are well done and do not limit your ability to see what's going on (something a lot of members of this genre have issues with)

full recommendation.


only critique I have is that the field of view is a bit narrow. not the FoV field of view, but your perspective - how much you see on the battlefield. 
and the first area is a bit dark. but these are nitpicks

Thought it was a fun twist on the normally fantasy-themed "bullet heaven" games. 

However, it's just too unfinished. Most of the features and levels are teased but not available. 

They put a little upgrade tree in there but it would take forever to grind it all out and the gameplay isn't varied enough to support that in my opinion. 

Download the demo and just stick with that for now. Maybe later it'll be worth it to purchase, but the full game doesn't offer much more than the demo right now.

The price is absolutely ridiculous for what it offers. The game is fine, but the music is awful. If it weren't my first bullet hell-type game, I probably would have figured out how bland it is so that I could refund it in time. There are games half the price that offers 10 times the quality of this.

Looking at the video, I was expecting a game like greedland, but a Zombie themed modern twin stick shooter. This is not that. With a controller, left and right analog sticks do the same thing, they turn and move in the direction that you press. You cannot aim and move independently. The game expects you to just move around and let it decide when to shoot. I guess there is a market for all kinds of games, but I feel like this is just a failed attempt at a twin stick shooter.

Cons

Only two maps
Rebalancing is MUCH needed

TL:DR 
It's Dead Nation for cell phones. 

I got the game on sale. it's early access, so I won't be too hard on it. 

I liked the combination of different characters. 
Each characters ability is different enough from each other and weapon routes give the game a lot of diversity. 

That being said, the stages are just a square. That made it kinda boring for me. 
Even getting the second stage available, while the mechanics vary and make it more challening, I really didn't feel it was enough. 

An actual map would be cool. 
An objective would be cool. 

All game modes are pretty much the same... wait for the time to run out = win. 

But, it's still in early access. So I hope the developers turn the feedback into a better experience. 

I'd say, for the price, yeah, get it. Even at full price it's really not expensive. 
Support the genre and have fun.

Very nice graphics. 
Extremely satisfying progression system. One of the best so far. Keeping RNG at a good mix.
Game already feels polished and there is a lot that still needs to be added.

Features include:
- zombies
- SWAT guys with pistols, SMGs, assault rifles, sniper rifles, gun turrets
- Heavy weapons guys with shotguns, miniguns, rocket launchers
- Engineer guys - with tasers, teslas, EMP grenades
- Huntress - archer lady with bow, multishot, explosive arrows
- Ghost - ninja quy with katana, shuriken and dagger throwing
- Medic - with medpacks and zombie antidote

But never mind that.  This game lets you select upgrades for weapons.  

If you're lucky.  REALLY lucky.  Once in a while, you may get offered.... A POTATO.

9.5/10   Would recommend.

(0.5 deducted as potato option does not come up often enough.)

+Like many I got into the reverse bull hell genre with Vampire Survivors and since then have tried several games in that genre trying to find another one I like. But with all of them I would play it and think "This is fine but VS did it better". Until I played this game. I'm not saying its better than VS but it was the first time I played a game in this genre and didn't think I should just play VS. I played the demo and as soon as my first run was done I ran over and bought the full version. I didn't even realize it was still in Early access because whats in the game is so polished.

Progression happens in two ways; first it's the amount of zombies killed while the leader and second it's in game leveling weapons and skills. Both work hand in hand to help you, the player, embody the roll of your survivor and play your way. 

It's in Early Access right now which I can only hope means they are going to make this bigger, better, faster, stronger as we continue to play their wonderful game. I really have been enjoying this title for the past 4 hours or so and look forward to many more as more and more content rolls out.

So, I played a bunch of games of the genre and I´d say it´s not "fleshed" out enough for me to recommend it to anyone. 

Pros:
- slaying a lot of zombies
- own spin with the "have a team of 3 characters" that have "unique" abilities
- there are some funny puns in the game 

Cons:
- There are barely any classes so far which makes almost every run feel the same
- The game feels the same between minutes 4-19 where you just do the same thing over and over again with very little change (in terms of power ups, gameplay loop, etc)
- generally the synergies just aren´t really there. Max out main weapon, upgrade, do the same for your other 2 chars
- the abilities don´t scale at all/aren´t balanced properly (steroids having too long cd for what they do)
- it lacks that scratching of the itch (e.g. Brotato, Vampire Survivors, Halls of Torment, ... all do that in their way - this game doesn´t)

Solutions:
1) Add more classes
2) Re-scale the abilities (make them scale with time, power-ups, SOMETHING)
3) Flesh out the progress tree (You can play for 5 hours and have all the decent perks)
4) Add some sort of synergy system that feels meaningful (the current ones are just bland and boring)
5) Add more enemy types (there are very few different enemy types in the game)
6) Re-balance the "wave system". As mentioned before minute 5-19 feels exactly the same, you run around, usually barely get hit, which makes most regen perks sort of pointless. Then suddenly the whole map is flooded and you die very quickly if hit. Feels super frustrating and boring to not be challenged before the very last minute, just to lose there.
7) Add some "long term reward system" that feels impactful, rewarding to progress and not easily obtainable
8) "Add a little bit of spice" (and by a little bit, I mean a lot) - the game maybe has potential but right now if just feels bland.

Nice to have a survivors-like game with a bit shinier graphics. The zombie apocalypse theme works well with the genre. The different characters all bring something different to the fight. Getting to put 3 of them together for your team makes for some powerful combinations. In the end though, I think there's not really that much choice. You pretty much always want to pick whatever gives the most DPS. Within your DPS options there isn't really much that feels different. Needs some work to provide you with more variety of viable options. The one area that is interesting is the challenges. Doing no hit challenge for example, requires a different strategy than the normal gameplay.

Still a fun game to play and certainly worth your time as is. Hopefully they keep expanding it and add more variety.

Game was fun for the most part.

Pros:
- Fun and Easy to Control. No need to aim much
- Graphics appealing, great zombie apocalyptic atmosphere 
- 20 minute games (if playing normal)
- Talent Trees/Upgrade System, Progressive

Cons
- Lack of Tooltips for skills when selecting class 
- Lacks replay-ability at the moment, since some maps, classes and Tier 3 skills are still not released yet
- Class/Team Synergy, almost forces the player to go a certain build to be efficient almost like making a cookie cutter build.
- Archer Class felt lacking, it just didnt feel as impactful, especially if paired with other classes like Tank. not saying that it is not good, just when you make a team of three, it just feels like Archer does nothing since slows dont really make a huge difference in the game play or you choose delayed damage where it does nothing since the other two classes will probably just kill the boss or zombies before your arrows explode.
- Medic (I know its a healer class) but it just feels like the Damage over Time skills or Slows just is a waste, since neither feel impactful enough that it is worth investing into since big hard hitting crits seem to be the best option overall.

Suggestions
- Wish there were more tooltips in class selection menu for the skills to describe what they did.
- Wish there were some built in passives for classes when you unlock Tier 2 or 3 for each class, for example, it would be really cool if the Gunner got ricochet bullets just as a built in passive once you got to tier 2.
- Wish single target weapons/skills felt more impactful, for example, the sniper rifle could have been a baretta and it creates a shockwave that did AoE damage that increases in size with skill level.
- Wish Damage Talents in the Tree felt more impactful, could not really tell if the points made a difference or not especially at start of the game.
- It feels like after a certain time, the player damage scaling plateaus while the enemy scaling continues to rise and it makes endless runs kind of pointless and not as fun and feel not as rewarding because you can only improve so far while the enemies only get stronger. You continue to level up and get money to get more talent points but then you max out your talent tree and buy everything and after that you just get nothing much out of it, its either money or health or skip....

It's actually pathetic how little variety and content it has for 10€. Upgrades boring and many useless ones, 2 stages is a meme.

2) Balance. Especially certain level 3 weapons, some of them do less damage than their level 2 weapons.. And everyone's damage is pretty much an absolute joke next to the Swat's Assault rifle.

Looking forward to future updates!

This is a funny Bullet Heaven Game! You can combine up to three survivors with different skill sets to beat a level. At the moment there are six different survivors so you have tons of possibilities to change your playstyle. With further progress you unlock more abilities (each survivor has four at the moment) and perks to rack up your stats, like more luck, more crit damage, reload time, etc. In addition you find addons during a run to beef up the stat sheet. 

There are different play modes in addition to the regular one, namely boss run or hardcore e.g. The balancing works pretty well, each mission feels manageable and not unbeatable. 

For now there are two maps, which are basically a squared place, so the difference is only in the visuals. The enemies on the contrary differ from map to map and therefore let you rethink your playstyle.  

I played the demo for roundabout three hours and found it convincing. The game feels great, controls are nice (and customizable. like changing autofire or autoaim), all in all it is a great way to waste your time. 

Highly recommended

It was my first time playing a game from the Reverse Bullet Hell - Survival Horde - Roguelike genre and honestly trying out new build paths to beat my previous records and hunting for achievements kept me coming back for more.

Difficulty isn't too much of a challenge as long as you get the hang of dodging enemy attacks and memorizing their movement and attack patterns, however, luck also plays a huge role depending on the classes you use.

In my opinion, further balancing for each of the classes' skill set, as well as damage output and utility would improve build diversity, as right now I find myself going for either the "Engineer, Tank & Medic" or "Ghost, Huntress & Swat" combos for both achievement hunting and Endless Mode.

This is a good example of early access - the gameplay is solid, all weapons and characters are fun to use and feel powerfull, the graphics are good, the music is very good and the gameplay is very smooth. 
That being said, I know it's still being developed but one big issue I have is that main weapons are way more powerfull than characcter abilities - basically it's a rush to evolve your main weapon to the max (except for medic - her first weapon does more damage than second or third)  and ignore most of the skills - Ghost, Medic have better abilities, but overall - you want to max out the weapons of your characters asap, and then you can mostly ignore the abilities untill you run out of stuff to level up.... which is a waste, some skills are fine, but most are a waste of points - they need to be either buffed or get more level ups. 
20 minutes run are the perfect time to not get boring and difficulty ramps up nicely. The game could use bigger bosses or maybe some more events during runs, but overall the concept of building a three-man team is fun and new... I hope there are items to equip in the future. The Training room needs more content - I've only played for 6 hours but already I maxed up all the important training options, and I'm left with mostly meaningless buffs (like ability cooldown / damage, invulnerability frames after hit and stuff like armor - which is pretty meaningless because the amount od damage from bossess overshadows any damage reduction due to armor - this needs more content, maybe a separate option for environmental buffs or handicaps you could enable? Like more or less chests, more or less bosses, tougher enemies, more drops, longer buffs etc etc. At this moment  - I don't have a big incentive to gather more money during run - because there is nothing I'm  dying to train asap. 
Finally some animations could use a little extra touch - the Ghost runs weird - his movements don't correspond to actual speed of walking - looks like he is running in zero gravity or slow motion. The medic has the same animation as the Swat, stuff like that. I encountered just one bug - when I played with the tank and died early on - the ending screen had a bunch of 1 and 0s  in the text box - and that's pretty much it . 
Looking forward to playing more of this game as it develops. 
As for final 3 characters - I would love a flame thrower guy, a grenade / molotov thrower and some kind of a machine - like a tank or an armed vehicle - this would be great. That being said, I'm going back to grind some final upgrades. 
Oh, and one final note to the devs - remember, just because some weapons are better than others - it's never a good idea to nerf stuff, it's better to buff the underpowered weapons. Swarm Grinder and even Halls of Torment have recently nerfed some skills  - and they game suffers because of this. I don't even want to play Swarm Grinder anymore because it's no longer fun. More damage is fun, less is boring.

EA, but so excited to see what's coming down the road. The devs respond relatively quickly and implement fixes quick.  Feedback has resulted in changes already and have future changes already slated based on feedback from players. Plenty to do for at least a "few" hours, but if you are a completionist, plenty to keep you busy on just one map and six characters. Endless mode will test even the fastest reflexes. If you played games like Crimsonland or some recent games like Vampire Survivors, this game is for you! The same essentially style of game where you choose a character and play various modes to survive. All while picking up and earning new items and upgrades. 

One cool thing about this game is as you play, you can pick up two two more characters that join your group and also kill zombies. You don't have to pick anymore people mind you and just instead skip it and earn some money and XP. And you can pick up and earn upgrades for them also! Which means there are many combinations of people to try and out, along side their abilities and weapons. 

To note this game is autofire. No firing yourself. Which I find more helpful as the game goes on and its hard to keep up with all the enemies. And the autofire will often try to attack the deadliest enemy first. 

As for upgrades/unlocks. How it works is if you play as someone you usually have a starting weapon and two starting abilities (one offensive, one defensive). If you kill a certain amount of enemies through some play throughs, you unlock the next stage of weapons for your character to use in future runs. 

For example one character  uses a shotgun. Your only upgrade is to an auto shotgun. But if you unlock the first stage of weapons, you can upgrade it during a run to a minigun or a rocket launcher. Said character also had a second stage to unlock which calls in air strikes every 30 seconds. There is also a third stage of weapon/ability unlocks but those are not available yet as the game is in early access. It should be noted all these weapons/abilities can be upgraded as you level up for better damage, more ammo...etc. 

The defensive and offensive skill abilities are hit or miss. It really depends on how you chose to play and with what character combos. Most abilities spawn every "X" amount of time. None of them follow you. There are all stationary abilities usually (such as a turret). Again, you can upgrade them in the run though to shorten the respawn time of them, the damage, the radius...etc. 

There is money in the game also, it is used to train. Basically a skill tree. More damage, more money, more xp, run faster....etc. 

Additionally there is an achievement system in game that unlocks more stuff. Such as perks. Perks (like in Crimsonland) that give you more things to choose form when you level up. Like 5% more damage, 2 points health regeneration...etc. Some high end perks can only be unlocked through some hard achievements. 

Because the game is in early access, the content isn't complete just yet. You do get 6 characters (you unlock over time) to play and two weapon/ability unlocks for each.  There is also only one level, but said level has a simple "Play until time runs out and its morning", "Endless play" where you last as long as you can, and a hardcore mode. There is much more stuff in the future that will be added and the games gets updated REALLY often. 

I really don't have an complaints. Feels like a Crimsonland game. Though if you played the companies other Zombie games, this is not like them in some ways. Heck, as of typing this (July 23rd), you can either but this game for $9.99, or buy the bundle for $9.59 which includes this game and the other three games the company made. Which I do enjoy!

-edit-
Updating the review now. Been awhile since the initial review and I still have nothing but positive things to say. They are releasing updates and patches every few weeks (sometimes sooner). And unlike many devs, they read the discussions area and take advice! I wish more teams would be like this!

Almost slept on this one. Simpler Unity "Zombie Survival" graphics and a name like "Yet Another Zombie Survival" aren't necessarily eye-catching in the current gaming market. But I've been on an arena roguelike kick so I nabbed it.

I'm glad I gave this a chance.

I'd say this is easily one of the greats. Not as much randomness to runs - but that's on account of your survivors each having their own unique spread of weapons and abilities, which only continue to broaden as you unlock new tiers by racking up kills with them.

You get up to 3 survivors in a team, so you decide what blend of skills you find in your upgrade pool. On top of crates that contain a more conventional set of randomized items to multiply your characters's stats.

The combat keeps you mobile with regular civilians and chests popping up on your map that you have to liberate, along with specialists and bosses that regularly spawn and complicate your position.

I have played a LOT of arena roguelikes, and while it has some *very* stiff competition, I'd say it's easily Top 5 - if not Top 3 of the 30 or so I've played now.

"Yet Another Zombie Survivor" – a game that initially entices with its unique gameplay, where managing a trio of characters as a team in a post-apocalyptic world offers a fresh strategic angle. The gameplay itself is solid, engaging players with a variety of tactical options. Graphically, the game meets expectations, providing a suitable backdrop for the zombie-infested environment.

However, the game suffers from an overreliance on certain meta strategies, which can make the experience feel somewhat restrictive after a while. The stability is commendable, but the game could benefit from more content to keep the experience fresh.

The real challenge, and sometimes frustration, comes from not always knowing where the next attack will come from. It’s like playing hide and seek with zombies, except they're really good at hiding and even better at seeking. And while I have no groundbreaking ideas to make the combat more transparent, a little more clarity wouldn't hurt.

"Yet Another Zombie Survivor" can feel a bit monotonous over time, but it's perfect for achievement hunters who get a kick out of unlocking every little thing. It’s like collecting stamps, but instead of stamps, it’s zombie heads. If you’re looking for a game that blends team-based strategy with a zombie apocalypse theme, keep an eye on the change log for updates that might spice things up. And hey, if you find it on sale, why not give it a shot? It might just be the zombie-slaying, team-managing, achievement-hunting game you never knew you needed.

Good gravy. I play a lot of the survivor-type bullet heaven games, and this is, by a large margin, the best one yet.

Great presentation. The models look nice, there is a clear style, the game is readable (which is an issue in other survivor games due to clutter), and the sounds are decent.

Great progression. It offers meta progression through skill points (money), survivor progression through number of kills, and smooth in-run progression.

Basically, I really love that these matches can be one, two, or three survivor(s). There's a lot of toying with synergies between the survivors and that makes runs feel very different. There are a few heroes to unlock right now and they even unlock new weapons and skills along the way. The leader system makes you try different things, too.

I really enjoy the skills, too. A cymbal clanging money that taunts?! A helicopter fly-by that you can actually see?! Love 'em!

There's only one map right now which can be a bit boring, but clearly there are more planned. I can't really fault an early access game for that. The game makes a wonderful first impression and if you like survivor games you're going to love this one. It just feels so good to play and I can't wait to see it evolve.

So, I saw the success of Vampire Survivors, and I wanted to try out This genre of game, but the graphics of that game are so bad that I had to look around for alternatives.  I recently tried out 5 games in the same style, Army of Ruin, Brotato, Soulstone Survivors, Spirit Hunters & Yet Another Zombie Survivors.  These games are all $10 or less, and I got them all on sale. (Brotato is on sale for $3.99 at the time of this review).

All of these games provided enough fun to justify their purchase, but the two that stuck out to me were SoulStone Survivors & Yet Another Zombie Survivors.  Both of these games were easier to jump right into and start having fun with.  YAZS was not as polished as some of the others, but I think it has great potential for the future, and is a lot of fun to play right now.

I really like the aesthetics of the game.  While a lot of other Vampire style games go for a fantasy setting, I enjoy the military commando style the game utilizes.  I got the game on sale, and it is certainly worth the small amount of money I spent on it.

Edit: Nov. 22 2023- I'm glad to see this game is getting lots of nice upgrades, making a very good game even better.

YAZS is a survival style game popularized by the well known title, Vampire Survivors. This title carves out it's own spot in an increasingly crowded market (as developers jump in on the survival single stick genre) by offering what I'll call a more "straight forward" approach to gameplay. Most survivors have weapons that are easy to understand (and utilize) while still offering the interesting decision making scenario that each player must deal with as they level up. The graphics are generally well done and present a more realistic visual on screen when compared with other titles in this genre.

All things considered, this game is worth checking out, if single stick survival is your kind of game.

At the moment, it's a very basic game. So far there's only one map with 3 different play modes.
You've got some perks to unlock, different weapons and abilities to use and tons of zombies to kill.
Additionally, three different boss types. That's basically it. 

Somehow I still had a lot of fun playing this.

All classes make sense if you use them right, and depending on how you combine them, you can easily unlock most achievements quickly. The only one that didn't work for me was "It's Raining Men".

Graphics, performance and animations are fine.

What bothered me about it was:

The annoying and monotonous music loop, wish there was some variety.
The mouse cursor will not disappear in the game. 
That we currently cannot manually aim our weapons. The game does this automatically.
The most disappointing by far is that there's currently no co-op or multiplayer and only two maps. 

Since this is just early access, I hope they will add more maps, gamemodes, and 1-4 player coop in the future. 

[h1] Overall, if you're into zombies and looking to spend 15-25 hours of fun with the chance for more in the future, it's a worthwhile game for a fair price. 
Just keep in mind that there's currently only two maps and that it can get repetitive.  [/h1]

The bullet hell/roguelike genre blend that came to be in the aftermath of Vampire Survivors has spawned some really good games and some real turds. This game leans more towards the good. Not only does it check all the boxes in the genre, but it adds a cool squad-based element which opens up a layer of new upgrades upon each addition to the squad. (Up to 3 squad members). It's just fun to play and that's all that can really be said beyond all the genre tropes.

At the time of this writing, it has all the makings of a great addition to the genre and does enough to stand out on it's own, even in an already over-saturated market. It's early access, and there's still a pretty significant amount of content to be added, but I think it's worth it now and will be even more worth it upon full release.

Some gameplay comments:
 - health regen stat is absolutely useless - it is not enough to make an impact either in early on late game and even if you invest stats by the late game you're already 1 or 2 hits and it takes a million year to regen anything. 

- not the biggest fan of having to stand on top of a power up for a few seconds before you are able to get it. Especially during late game where you are dead in 1 hit - it throws me off of my momentum and can be disorienting at times. 
I've unlocked probably 90% of all the upgrades in 11 hours. That 11 hours was really fun, I just hope they could dish out more content in the future.

Has great potential, but currently badly balanced and paced. Like the other reviewer, I wish there was a more neutral rating available. I will rate the game as it currently is, and re-review it as it gets closer to being complete, in the context of other games both in this genre and closely related ones.

The good:
1. Great modern graphics and runs reasonably well. I'm so tired of the absolute spam of "pixel art style" games.

2. Some novel aspects like the recruiting survivors mechanism which helps give players control over their builds. I think the limited map size can be turned around into useful positioning features too, later in development.

3. Devs are actively working on the game and communicating, and have a pretty solid track record.

4. A bit controversial take, but I think the pricing is fair. There is currently a strange race-to-the-bottom pricing war in this genre, especially amongst the "pixel art style" games which I suspect, to put it as nicely as possible, are easier to (re-)produce to a minimally "viable" state and get listed. Those models are not sustainable, and hurt both devs and waste players time.

The bad:
1. The vast majority of abilities are functionally useless. They activate once every business month, to let out a fart that annoys zombies within smelling distance. Zombies are almost never within this smelling distance unless you are milliseconds away from dying. There are like 3 useful abilities in the game, mostly passive stat boosts or essentially a 2nd main weapon. Also please remove periodic buffs. In games like this, players have no agency over when they are active or useful, inconsistency SUCKS.

2. The majority of skill point upgrades and item container upgrades are also functionally useless. They're like 5% damage, 5% reload speed, and they're infrequent enough due to the dilution pool that it'll never reach noticeable levels. Come on. 

3. Pacing issues. Early meta progression is practically non-existent, related to above point. Within each round, exp level progression falls off a cliff around level 30 onwards. 

4. Balance/Clarity issues. There are some projectiles which chunk like 1000+ dmg. Could be dodged early game, but in the late game spam impossible to see. I'm pretty sure enemy damage universally scales up, these curves need granular attention. Some classes have level 3 weapons which are functionally worse than level 2.

[h1]Played On Steam Deck[/h1]
Yet Another Zombie Survivors is a pretty good take on the horde survival genre. I enjoyed the unique characters with different weapons and abilities, also how you can pick any 3 to create your dream team. 

Where this game excels is the graphics (really gorgeous visuals), the game engine (no abrupt frame drops in high intensity situations) and the team building aspect. 

Where the game falls a bit short is the “samey”ness, every run feels exactly the same. I’ve got 7.3hrs logged and I’m already getting bored with the same content. Mobs are mostly the same on the two available maps. Hopefully this improves with the journey through early access. Another shortcoming is the characters are not balanced and there is a clear build to succeed each time after you’ve looked at dps for a few runs. 

Overall it’s a fun one to try out, a bit in the expensive side (most horde survivals are ~$5) but I would say I’ve gotten worthwhile fun out of getting it for $8 on sale.

I've been playing on steam deck and the performance is good early game but drops frames pretty heavily later on in the run. The content also feels minimal right now with only a couple of maps being out but the characters and abilities give the game a lot of replayability.

Why you should buy this game (ALSO A NOTE FOR DEVS) 

Remember the fun upgrade games of the Kongregate era? That is EXACTLY what this is. Just, you know, more modern, and not a streaming game. I know, you all have other genre names you use for this game. It's an upgrade game. And that is not a bad thing. 

Quick run down. I won't bore you. 

There is ZERO story here. It's not needed. This is a run around and kill zombies game. 
Upgrades include in game non permanent as well as earned "training" permanent upgrades you can spend after a run.  

Achievements give rewards. Almost everything you do in this game has some reward attached to it. So you never feel like you are just "grinding", or wasting time. I am only 3 hours in as of this writing, and have felt a fair amount of progression, enough to keep me hooked and playing, but not so much that it feels too easy or boring. 

I won't bother telling you what kind of game this is. You can read, it's in the description. What I CAN tell you, is this game is fun and very well made. If you like upgrade games, because again that's what this is, you will LOVE this game. Buy it. It's fun. 

NOTE FOR DEVS.. a couple of quality of life suggestions. 

In the achievement screen, it would be nice to be able to hover over rewards and see what they are and what they do. This can assist in the strategy of what achievements you go for first. 

Also, I feel like when you get the SOS, and choose to send to bunker, on top of the money and level, there should also be a moderate heal. Sometimes you fight through swarms to get there, so a heal reward would make it that much more satisfying to reach it. Not a full heal or anything crazy, but like 150 -250 health points would still be very useful, especially if you are almost dead. 

Lastly, maybe a (optional) 2 or 3 screen tutorial explanation of how elements work in the game. Experience, money, and some of the more key pick up items on the field. Going in really blind can be frustrating for a new player, if they don't know what things do or what to go for. 

Happy to give this game a HUGE thumbs up. Runs great for this type of game, not buggy, super fun, easy to play no complicated menus or learning curve required. Just jump in and start blasting. Buy it. Honestly this is the most fun game I have bought on Steam in quite awhile. 

Thanks gamers and have fun.
