Really wish steam had a "meh" selection instead of yes or no - I am going to revisit later in to EA but I went with Not Recommended because I am hoping to see the game improve from its current state. Breakdown below.

Pros
- Smooth gameplay - controls feel responsive and keys are mapped similar to other games in the genre.
- Nice looking and pretty cool settings; though I wish you could weave through buildings in a city and really pump up the volume of the hoards.
- Pretty awesome music - and it doesn't get overly redundant because the matches are short.
- The 2nd map changes up the normal formula in an interesting way. Tremors sort of way.
- Zombies and guns = what more could you need? (Answer: A bit more it would appear)
- Potatos.

Cons
- Some of the characters, full upgraded, feel like they just cannot go all the way even with a good supporting cast. See other point below.
- Upgrades feel insignificant both in game and the general account wide ones bought from main menu.
- Supply drops don't feel very rewarding - outside of happiness and a couple others.
- Endless maps are not needed at this stage because by the time you can survive past the 40ish min mark, you have unlocked everything in the game already. You cannot infinitely upgrade your characters and eventually you just collect money on level ups - but there is nothing to spend it on after everything is unlocked.
- The game fails to really fulfill what makes the genre so attractive in terms of scaling your power and thinking through options until you become nearly godlike. It tends to fall down to a specific buildout every time (I wont mention it as to avoid spoiling but its not hard to figure out once everything is unlocked.)
- As of now, it is not worth the price tag. As others have pointed out, there are far better bargains for the money that will fit the Bullet Hell genre feel better.

Let's start by saying, I can't give a bad review to a game that starts with "Yet Another" reminding me the old days of YAST in Suse Linux :D

Anyway, let's lay the cards on the table and just say this is not a AAA game, same for the price tag, graphically the game is very appealing, I didn't have any issues with performance, I'm running  a 1080Ti and everything is smooth even when the game get's ultra crowded. 
It's a fun game for a few hours, I have close to 38h and was able to unlock everything that the game has available to unlock at the moment. 
Gameplay wise, the RNG does it for me, it's fun having to deal with the unfortunate crappy upgrades or the fact that you don't get the class you wanted, it's all part of the challenge. yes there are some useless upgrades and some stuff could be tweaked but all in all you can go through the game with ease, I tend to build for a lot of AoE, Crit Dmg, Fire Rate etc..and seems to work all the time, even in Hardcore.

My personal opinion is, some classes could be reworked, I find Huntress and Medic a bit underpowered compared to the other classes, where Ghost is the star of the game combined with either Swat or Tank.
But again they still due to implement the 3rd rank of skills so it might change for the future.

As I said, you will go through the game quickly, and once you unlock all the upgrades you pretty much done, at least I was, but the value for me is, it's a game I have in my favourites on my Steam Library, and when they slowly introduce new content or patch I like to give it a go, and even sometimes I just jump in to kill some Zombies.

Is it worth the money, I do think so, as I said, is a fun game to play with a lot of room for content and improvement, so it's a plus for me.
It's fun, I want more.

Update. Well worth it for the current content.
Visually very pleasing. If you have engineer companion with laser auto-targeting on 4k HDR it may cause blindness, but it was completely worth sacrificing my vision to view the laser bounce from enemy to enemy.

There are currently 6 classes that can each be leveled twice, with the 3rd upgrade tier on the way. Swat class feels OP, although I would argue the strongest as a companion, as you have to aim with your starting class and then gain another max 2 companions which auto targets enemies. Ghost class can be used as your main class for a complete hands off experience, which can be quite satisfying.

I hope to see some additional enemies added and more evolving as the timer progresses. To beat the normal game mode you need to survive for 20 minutes, which makes the runs nice and short compared to many other survivor games. Some additional enemy types would be great for endless mode.

The map(s) is rather small, so exploring all of it happens rather fast. More locations are also on the way, but I would prefer focus to be on enemy variety.

All in all, I give this a solid 5/7
It's doing some things right, but needs a lot more depth.

Very nice instalment for this genre, especially regarding the graphics. YAZS is fast paced, dimly lit and visceral. Interesting branching skill trees for each survivor. It's clearly still lacking content [being early access] but I'm really liking the foundation that the developers have built so far. 

I only have a few criticisms from what I've seen so far:
- The game is a little *too* fast paced; this may be by design but it would be nice to see accessibility settings  that allow you to slow down the game speed a little to suit the player's preference. 
- Visual effects sometimes make it difficult to see what's going on. It will be nice when settings are added to tone that down a bit. 
- Dodging in this game is often near impossible; your group of survivors has a huge hitbox that makes it nigh impossible to weave through a tight gap without taking a hit

The only real issue I have right now is the audio - the music specifically sounds like baby Animal from the Muppet Babies going crazy on the drums. So, turn off the music (for now), kick back, and enjoy a decent Survivors-like.

i've played far too many survivorlikes/bullet heavens to keep track of. This one is a mundane as they come, lacking any sort of skill or prior knowledge of the genre. Yet... Its probably one of the best time wasters the genre has to offer. No crazy synergies to memorize, no quests or crazy challenges, everything works and everything is simple. Upgrade guns to get stronger guns, upgrade powers to get stronger powers, dodge zombies until you win. Unlocks are "use this character a bunch", unlock skill points to get stronger, its all very basic. The gameplay itself is just plain old zombie killing fun. Blood, gore, bodies flying, shooting a minigun into a crowd and watching them turn into mist, its borderline psycho behavior and i love it.

Only cons are the performance on newer maps, some characters are terribly annoying to level up (medic mostly), and although i enjoy the simplicity i would like some form of synergy or transformation when certain conditions are met. The game is a tad barebones right now, but $10 is completely fair regardless. Great little time waster.

i did discover there's some fun physics like you can literally blow enemies sky high with rocket launcher or other explosive weapons... i guess if you really scratch under the surface and realise that this game seems to have 3d ish physics, a nice looking graphic style, smooth no hiccups frame rate, its pretty fun.

my advice at first would be to play each character to see what you prefer!

This game is a Rogue Like, Sandbox, Horde run. Think of the Isometric perspective of D3, that had a baby with Vampire Survivors and CoD. This pre release is insanely fun. I say it better than Vampire Survivors. The Skills are more impactful and feel different. This is mainly due to the fact that it is a 3D rendition with guns. 

I do have to say as of the current patch, the Rank 2 Engineer is broken AF. The Energy shield is Garlic, but has huge end game use. because it freezes trash mobs. I guess the balance is that the bosses are immune to the effects. 

I do think they need to add difficult scaling much like Brotatoe. That way it'll give Dex a challenge.

"I'll check this game out for a minute" ... where did 5 hours go? Addictive. Fun. Time for another run.

3D but less content, feels like a mobile game. Goes to show how Bullet Heaven games are lazy development. Minor fun for the thirty minutes I played but requested a refund. Dev team needs to work on it alot more for it to be worth playing for more than that.

As for right writing this review i would recommend the game as it is fun to kill time on and the "Potential" there.

That being said the game is pretty bare bones still as it is EA and has alot of room left to grow and build on.

The General idea of the game is there and can be enjoyable but as you get further along in the game you do find there is kinda Ideal  playstyles to compositions and item choices; more so for doing the harder content the game has for the moment.

The breakdown is more as such.

[b]Meta Progression-[/b] Pretty basic..nothing here thats gonna surprise you in the least. You get money during your playthru's and you spend them here for simple upgrades that make you characters feel more viable in their runs. Long term something deeper here would be nicer or maybe just add some class based upgrade choices. You could also make upgrades limited so you have say a finite number to pick so you have to choose more over just having everything unlocked and it not feeling very impactful.

[b]Gameplay-[/b] The game is pretty much your standard title for this area of things. The games are 20 mins long by default and the goal is simply just survive..no big baddie at the end or anything. At the start you only have 3 classes to pick from and you can unlock 3 more over time. During the gameplay you level up and pick skills separated between a gun tree or class based abilities.
On the map itself you'll have chests appear during the game that have items to add to your run that give various stats. You also have what they refer to as a SOS ( think like a chest for your character ). It allows you to select a 2nd and 3rd character to your team or forgo the addition to take a level up instead. Ultimately there is some strategy to waiting and sometimes you just want to choose the added character to your group. It does come with the trade off of having a larger Hitbox for your team for mobs to strike; So bare that in mind as you close unto the Character cap ( 3 ) on your run.

[b]Unlocks-[/b] There is unlocks for a few things. One is unlocking more characters in general; which require meeting certain goals ( things you'll do naturally playing anyways ). The other is unlocking the remainder of the characters abilities to play with on runs. The path to unlocking those is pretty straight forward..just kill mobs and they'll unlock naturally basically. The last thing is items you find in the treasure chests during runs. These are a bit weird in how their done..they are unlocked thru achievements in the game. So in a way you are basically required to complete in game goals to even get the item unlocks.

Personally the game is fun as it is but as stated the content is rather sparce at the moment; so depending how much time you plan to sink into it..you may breeze thru it pretty quickly.
A few issues i'd say with the time of writing this is simply the meta progression is kinda bland and needs more work.
Also the level up during the gameplay is kinda..idk..theres alot of options for only 20 mins of play and your never going to unlock everything on a normal run so you end up having to just cherry pick a perfered path and ignore skills to save points.
Lastly i'd say the items leave alot to be desired...
For example..you have one set of items thats simply tied to a achievement and does literally nothing else but stays in your loot pool for the rest of the game. Also alot of the choices are just bad and are basically gonna be auto skipped or banned every run regardless of your build. Ideally better choices need to be added in place of some that exist. Either lean in on the good ones and design more based around those..or add class based items that only pop up if you have that class in your team for that run or just something more..otherwise its kinda a small pool of usable items mixed with worthless ones kinda.

Another Bullet Hell/Vampire Survivors style game. Is it any good? Yup, its good fun.

It can get pretty crazy if you have a bunch of teammates and air strikes coming in from helicopters,etc.. it can get very hectic and its alot of fun.

Steam deck review: These type of games are perfectly suited for steam deck (and its one of the main reasons I bought it): quick sessions (20 mins )and you can pause/sleep/continue anytime you want. Performance wise, well, erhm,  atm it is not optimised very well, once you pass like 10+min mark the game tends to drop below 25fps on default settings, changing some graphic settings improves the performance a bit but it is still far from being ideal. I keep my hopes up for future improvements. It is playable but just not super smooth.

A good game.

Very fun survivors clone, feels fast and frantic and balanced to be tough but not overwhelming. Once you reach the late stages, some options for OP builds become available, but unless you seek them out they do not force themselves upon you. The randomness of the available options for each level up is a problem, especially when opening item chests, as the pool of available options is too broad and the tools for managing it are too limited. 

Sounds are great, and even though the soundtrack is just one song on repeat, it's a solid background track. Booms and splats and zaps sound visceral and impactful, and the graphic impact of your explosions and heavy hits is satisfying. Graphics are solid but not exceptional, especially survivor animations (ghost, please stop wobbling as you run, you look like an idiot) and optimization at higher enemy density both need a lot of work still.

It has room to grow yet, but I still have already had 21 hours of fun blasting zombies and am looking forward to more.

I like this dev's other games like Fury Unleashed, and I was surprised they went this route, but I think it worked out for them. The "build your own group" aspect and relatively grounded setting of the typical zombie outbreak for a Survivor-like game is pretty nice. It actually looks and sounds good, which for this genre can be hit-or-miss from a visual standpoint.

It's getting there in terms of content, but I don't know if it will have the staying power or the aesthetic cohesion of something like Halls of Torment, but it's good for what it is. 7/10.

Overall - (During EA: 8/10)

Cons:
-Viewing angle sometimes works against you.
-Sudden increases in difficulty make it tough to keep track of your overall strength.
-Hit feedback is not very clear. A more pronounced audio or visual queue would make for a nicer experience.
-Meta progression feels too shallow at the moment, though this could be fixed as the game is completed.

Pros:
-Excellent sound design. From the effects to the music, it really grips you.
-Squad system. Choosing abilities and weapons from a combination of squad members is an ingenious way to keep you experimenting with different combos for hours.
-Weapon tier advancements feel powerful and meaningful.
-Not an easy survivors game to reach net-0 movement, if possible at all. I have yet to achieve it.
-Interesting bosses that each need to be handled differently.
-Big potential. Keep an eye on this one.

It's 12th of September, 2023 - developers released new minor hotfix 0.3.3 patch. Hotfix includes zombie speed stat growth for endless mode which was huge issue. Now it is actually doable and possible to reach 30 minute mark in game. But at the moment that does not mean that all problems are solved, not even close. I would give this review mixed option because default characters are still not finished and they lack last upgrade that is shown in game with coming soon place holders.

Previous update:

It's 8th of September, 2023 - developers released new minor 0.3.2 patch. The patch contains sort of fix for endless mode zombie ultra speed. However i did not felt difference for some reason because i still can't get pass 25 minute mark no matter what characters i chose, also engineer's plasma shield becomes useless because zombies just run through it instead of stunning/holding them back. Characters still do not prioritize zombies which are in face and instead shoot boss zombies who are 5 meters away. BS. Therefore still not recommended.

Older update:

As of August 29th developers released first "major" 0.3 update. After testing out this new update i will say that review will remain negative for time being.

Barely anything new added. There is only 1 new map with couple new enemies for that specific map only and that is it. Not even new character or weapons or abilities, well at least something like that.
Even current characters are not finished, just keep that in mind. There supposed to be 4 levels (rank) for each character with their specific unlocks and yet only 3 levels are available. Waiting 1.5 months for update and you get 1 map with couple new enemies. What is this?

yes, "but"

pro: 
- decent graphics, feels good. explosions and stuff have a nice splash. 
- graphed attacks so you can dodge
- some weapons / abilities are interesting or somewhat pleasing
- you can have 3 instead of the usual 1 guy to play as, making up small "combos" of abilities. 
- its just 10$ which is quite the selling point

con: 
- some abilities are absolutely useless xd. DPS isnt even in the same potency. same with the characters and their combinations. there isnt much to "choose" from as there are only a couple characters and their combinations are obvious. 
- even with maxed speed to outrun and enough damage to basicly oneshot those thin almost unseeable speeder zombies, you get run down by them at some point in endless mode. would prefer if you could scale forever if you PLAY WELL instead of getting the "speed stat" checked at a certain minute (mutation) mark. also bosses should be the biggest threat, not the little critters :P
- speaking of bosses. monster variety is poor. 2 "mini" bosses, one ranged single projectile spitter and 2 trashmobs (one is the speed, the other a generic zombie). 
- perma upgrades are simple stat checks as well (more damage, more speed, more gold, more exp, more crit, more crit damage etc. nothing special IMO). 
- only two maps so far, nothing much to do there either, its just background (no interactables etc.)
- you reach a point where you upgraded everything decently fast with nothing left to do but walk around and waitfor the speeders to reach you :D 
- not many abilities to choose from. the ones you can unlock take forever. IMO you should be able to unlock them for all 3 played not just the leader. 

conclusion: its very superficial but if it had more depth it would be very good. for 10$ its still recommendable short fun.

I’m quite conflicted if I should recommend this game or not. Overall I have fun with it but in its current state it has a lot of issues. Parts of my complaints could mean the game is just not made for me. Which is fine. So if the negative points sound positive to you, take this review as a recommendation. Keep in mind the game is early access and stuff will probably subject to change.

TLDR: Solid VS-like with nice visuals but with a slow incremental progression that could be an issue for certain players.

The Good:

- The 3D look with nice dynamic lighting effects and satisfying gore and ragdolls is a bit of a standout in the VS-like Genre. It definitely enhances the general gameplay experience.

- Setting: Zombies should be a nobrainer for a horde genre so this is just fitting perfectly. Mowing down hordes of Zombies is just satisfying.

- The game uses a squad system instead of a single player character. The player chooses one starting character and can add up to 2 more during a given play. Each squad member has unique abilities and a weapon that can be separately levelled from the others. This has a lot of potential for mixing and matching of different squad members to enhance their strength. You can add new members through saving survivors of the zombie apocalypse.
An especially good mechanic is how you add new squad members. Every minute or so you have the opportunity to save a survivor. Doing that gives you the choice of hiring a new member or save the survivor. The second option gives you money (for meta progression) and a player level. This creates the interesting dynamic in the early to mid game of deciding when to add a new member or level the existing ones. It also adds a source of steady linear improvement throughout the game. This is especially helpful in the late game, where the level progression is heavily slowed down by the semi exponential experience requirements. 

- The different squad members abilities and weapons are quite fun and diverse. Levelling those and choosing your squad members accordingly for synergy is really nice and has much potential. As far as I know this is also a unique mechanic in the VS-like Genre

- Supply drops and saving survivors always keeps you moving on the map. This is a mixed bag, because it also invalidates stationary play styles which rely on planting turrets and the like.

The not so good:

First I want to reitarete that this is early access and the game is subject to change, If the devs read this and think “yep everything works as intended” than that is completely fine and just means that this game is not for me. 

- Even though the squad system suggests player freedom and experimentation right now that is not the case. Some characters just don’t go well with another (which is fine) and there are essentially just two play styles. Those are reliance on weapons or the abilities. If you go the weapon route you take damage, crit, crit damage, reload speed and attack speed. There could be small adjustments made according to weapon speciality but it does not matter much. If you focus on abilities you take cool down reduction and ability damage, as well as squad members with more active abilities. While this is decision making, two options for an overall play style isn’t that much. In Endless this matters little, because you have to level everything anyway to keep up with the scaling.

- Metaprogression is boring. You can earn money in game to spend on permanent upgrades outside of it. These upgrades are absolutely genre standard eg health, attack speed, attack damage etc. The improvements are always small but that’s okay. They matter bought in bulk and are mainly for motivation its just uninspired and utilitarian, can be improved alot. I take more issue with the squad member metaprogression. Unlocking a new character gives them a weapon + one evolution and two abilities. You can unlock more weapon upgrades and abilities per character through unlocking tiers. These are unlocked by killing zombies with the specific characters as squad leader. That’s it. Just kill 20000 Zombies with this character and after that do it again and again and again. A successful standard run gives you about 9000 dead Zombies. I have no issues with the game asking me to unlock them it is just super boring and feels like grind. Why are the unlock conditions not something different per character that also corresponds to their theme? There is a lot of potential improvement to be made here.

-  There are two path of progression ingame. One is levelling you squad members (which is nice) the other one is looting supply drops that spawn every minute or so. These give you, in contrast to levelling, stat improvements for health, attack damage, etc. The improvements are quite small for example +10% weapon damage or -10% reload speed. Some of them can be felt more than others. They are essentially for progress they just don’t feel very exciting to get because of their inherent blandness.
If you unlock various achievements you also unlock new items that can be found in the supply caches. While this sounds like good meta progression it really isn’t. That’s because the new items are not only boring sometimes day are a straight up downgrades to existing items. Many of the new items are just two stats mixed instead of one e.g. instead of 10% weapon damage you now get 5% wd and 5% reload speed. Its essentially the same as before just now the stat improvement feel even more meaningless. Some are also just worse. For example a standard item gives you 15 armor, an unlockable item gives you 5% weapon damage (alright but lame) and 5! armor. I know its just a loss of 2,5 armor BUT it feels bad and other combination items have the 7,5 armor so it just doesn’t not make sense. Also there is standard item that heals 500 health. An unlocked one now gives you 50hp/s for 10 seconds (500hp) but you loose 100 max health.. that is just a straight up downgrade and the item is useless. 
All of these new items also muddy the pool of available items. Because many of them are at best the same as before but more boring (stat splitting) or straight up worse you wait much longer for the items you really need for your build and/or expend a much higher amount of banish and reroll as before. So this meta progression makes the player experience actively worse, because most items are not useful. 
This is not necessarily a flaw of the system (there are some good unlockable items which are not fully stats based) but of the execution and I think that can be greatly improved in early access.

- only two maps

End:
Its already long enough. I’ll keep an eye on the updates. I really think the game can improve a lot. The underlying system is solid and just needs refinement. Many of my complaints are subjective and maybe intended by the dev.
 I’ll update the review accordingly

It's a yes, mainly because it's a good experience, but it fails to offer anything fresh if you’re looking for something different in this genre. The auto-shooter/bullet heaven category’s absolutely littered with low-poly Vampire Survivors (VS) clones, and while Yet Another Zombie Survivors (YAZS) doesn't meaningfully innovate, it does have a comfortingly casual gameplay loop with a contemporary art direction.

Instead of curating a suite of complementary weapons and passives (as you do in VS), YAZS has you choose survivors to form a trio. Each survivor has an evolving weapon set, inbuilt passive stat buff, and a selection of abilities you can choose from that trigger when off cooldown. It’s a fun tweak to the VS formula, but doesn’t have the depth of VS’s approach, which is a little damning considering how limited the genre’s depth already is.

Part of what makes VS good is it’s about taking a concept and seeing how silly you can make the execution. Have a character that gains a stacking area increase to their abilities? What weapons would this power enhance to a busted level? What passives do I need for those weapons to get evolutions? What evolutions would pop off even harder? These thoughts flow easily into a build that ends up being world-shakingly ridiculous because VS is all about making the insane happen. As graphic effects chaotically fill your screen, blinding your ability to even see where you’re going, you realise that VS is a game that’s laughing at its own ridiculousness, and it’s all the better for it.

Comparatively YAZS offers a much more grounded approach. The combinations of survivors, abilities, and item power-ups never reach the kind of chaos that VS offers, because the stat side is much more constrained, and the more realistic setting keeps it centred in a way that VS never tries to be. YAZS’ item choices are fairly pedestrian, shying away from the kind of stat madness that VS goes for, and its character abilities don’t have the sheer insanity that permeates VS. But that doesn’t mean there isn’t a certain pleasure in YAZS’ simplicity. You’re always kept moving in search of the next drop or powerup, and the quiet accumulation of weapon power and abilities against the rising zombie tide feels well-paced and pleasing.

VS is still the undisputed king of this genre, and I sincerely doubt YAZS has the depth or potential to improve enough to ever challenge VS, but I had a good time with it and I’m certain it’ll get more enjoyable as content is added. If you want something more "realistic" than the silliness of VS then YAZS is a good option.

OK so nearly after 22 hours in this game, i feel like i can comment on this game.  In it current state (update 0.03) it feel...  meh... The way the author put the news out makes it sound like they have these epic sounding updates, but sadly this is far from reality. 

THIS GAME IS DRASTICALLY OVER PRICED - wait for a sale.  Nearly all games in the genera are $3-$5 bucks. This one is $10 and it its current state feel like it should be 3-4 dollars.

Nearly all the skills after your main weapon abilities do not feel fun to use and are boring and completely lack invocation. After playing for 5-10 hours you pretty much know what weapons to use, what skills to have and what team members to pick 100% of the time.  There is very little build diversity so you are basically forced to go with the same build every run. 

The "new abilities" that are added in the second tree (as of 0.03), feel like a bad joke as they feel like there is no reason why the DEV/DEVS would not just combine a lot of the secondary abilities into one skill, to give them greater impact. This design feels like a poor excuse for padding game time for new players, than something interesting or useful.  

I want to like the game and for the moment i will not give it a thumbs down, but my recommendation is "DONT BUY NOW" and wait for a sale, and watch the updates... maybe by version 5 this game wont be so boring. 

The amount of weapons that are currently in the game feel underwhelming, currently there are 2 maps which are basically the same things... UwU... I mean if they are going to put out these kind of trash maps heck just spam 10 more least there would be a different stuff to look at and break the boredom. 

The main reason why i will not give it a thumbs down entirely it explosives feel epic and have impact. Which is on archer and tank. Laser on Engineer and sniper on Swat feel good. Tanks Mini gun is good!

-The "Engineer" feels great in nearly all of his abilities.. so congrats on him. the emp/shock Grenades are kinda dumb - everyone has Grenades. so who cares.  Tazer is boring - tesla coil feels better than the Blaster or laser and always feel like a downgrade every time i upgrade to the next weapon. Skills - Electric turret is cool but boring, energy shield is BADASS, Electrocution feels stupid and is too slow. 

-"Swat" feels decent over all, UZI is stupid needs a buff or a rework, sniper riffle feels fun, assault riffle is standard but feels good. other skills feel kinda meh with Helicopter strike and Turrets are just OK
 
-Tank- shotgun is boring, pump-action-shotgun is the same as shotgun only now you have two round burst - so who cares.  Mini-gun feels good, Rocket Launcher feels GREAT. Other skills - Saw blades are good, landmines are meh. Bombing strike is EPIC

- Ghost is interesting...
- Medic is slow and boring...
- Huntress is boring...

- I am getting bored writing this game review at this point - Hope this was helpful if you are on the fence about it.

Rating: ★★★★★ (5/5)

"Yet Another Zombie Survivors" brings a refreshing twist to the survival horror genre. Developed by dedicated indie creators, this game stands out with its unique blend of strategic gameplay and relentless zombie encounters.

Gameplay: ★★★★★
In a post-apocalyptic world, players must manage a group of survivors, making tough decisions about resource allocation and combat strategies. The game's real-time resource management system adds depth, as players balance survival needs with the risks of scavenging.

Graphics and Atmosphere: ★★★★★
While not groundbreaking, the graphics effectively capture the game's grim setting. Minor glitches and occasional frame rate drops slightly disrupt the experience but don't detract significantly.

Story and Progression: ★★★★
The narrative takes a backseat, focusing more on survival challenges. Character stories are somewhat shallow, and a richer narrative could have added more depth. The game's pacing, introducing new enemies and challenges, keeps the gameplay engaging.

Conclusion:
"Yet Another Zombie Survivors" offers a unique spin on survival horror. With its innovative gameplay mechanics, strategic depth, and tense atmosphere, it's a notable choice for those seeking a fresh take on the zombie apocalypse genre.

I originally gave this a positive review but I honestly can't get over the sound and music choices in this game. The actual gameplay loop is solid but there HAS to be better sound options out there to use on your game regardless of developer funds. Lot of the gun sounds lack power and instead of making it feel like I'm blasting zombies, it just makes me want to mute. 

Speaking of mute, I put the music slider on 0% for the last 8 hours. Stage 1 sounds like a loop of zombie moans and guitar rifts that would fit an end of match information screen, not something I hear for 30 minutes. New map came out today and again the stage music is just forgettable. Think of any well reviewed and loved games and you will also think of iconic sounds and stage themes. Please dont underestimate sounds. Even if people don't actively notice, sound design is critical to overall enjoyment. This dev is doing a great job on all other aspects which is why its so disappointing to have this problem with sound.

Simple fun, clear game play, can lose yourself in it pretty easily.

Although the art style is more gritty and realistic, this reminds me a lot of Zombies Ate My Neighbors. Obviously, a Bullet Hell game has streamlined game play. Currently there are no multiplayer modes either... but if you check out the road map and see what the Developer has planned, it's quite ambitious. He is off to a rocket start.

I mean...It's about average at best. It's not bad, but it's not a lot of fun either for a Survivor-like.

There's no fun weapon combination or fusions, there is little randomness to what you're offered, every character only has 2 abilities at base, and unlock 4 more once you've played with them for a couple of rounds.

The characters aren't very interesting, the bosses aren't interesting, the only 3 mechanics you have to worry about are a single ranged enemy, a charging boss, and poison puddles on occasion, that's it.

There's only a single level, and you can either play that level for 20 minutes, or infinitely, that's it.

You can save up some currency for some standard "Abilities deal x%/y%/z% more damage" type upgrade trees, which is just boring, feels terrible to save up for, and is just uninspired.

The game just needs...more...More randomness, better enemies, more maps, WAY more weapons/upgrades, weapon fusions, dropped powerups; just...a lot more needs to be done to justify the price right now, because Vampire Survivors and Holocure do this job IMMENSELY better for CHEAPER. And if you want to spend money for a good survivor-like, Soulstone Survivors blows this game out of the water.

I jsut can't in good faith recommend this game in it's current state, it's too bare-bones for the price.

I don't often write reviews.  I figure, "Why bother?  Everyone has different tastes."
However, I want to throw some support to indie developers.  AAA games don't try new things or push limits.  Diablo 4, it's Diablo.  It's been the same game for 4 iterations.  It's still a bit of fun, but there's nothing new in it.

When I bought Yet Another Zombie Survivors, I was looking for some killy fun.  The kind of game you can pick up and put down for a short bit of stress relief.  I was half right.  I picked it up, then wound up playing 3.5hrs.  Luckily this was a weekend!

Upgrading a weapon and watching the front lines of a zombie horde melt, will bring a tear to your eye.
When you're surrounded and dying and you hear the sweet music of a helicopter obliterating a path through the zombies 
   for your escape, you will cheer.
You unlock a new weapon, you play the character and upgrade to the new unlock.  Rockets flare and blow great chunks out 
   of the horde.  

You will want more.  More carnage.  More destruction. More explosions, zombies, upgrades, buffs, boss zombies, BRING THEM ON you'll scream out in defiance!  You'll glare at your screen and choose a leader and cackle.  Then you'll notice the time and wish you had more of that too.

If you enjoy the genre, you'll enjoy the game.  There are choices to make along the way.  Do I continue with a single character and max them out?  Do I get 2 other characters to join ASAP?  That means you'll level abilities slower, more choices means lower odds of being displayed when you level up.

Each character that joins your squad has a passive buff and their own abilities.  Which mesh best with your current squad?

If you lust for undead carnage, if you want some mindless (hah!) violence, pick this up.  Or at least add it to your wishlist and wait for the additional content.  I'm having a blast (also hah!).  Easily the most fun I've had playing a game in a long time.

Pretty good and satisfying gameplay. There's not much in the game right now but it's still in early acess so it's expected.
My main problem with the game at the moment is that there isn't much room for choices, each character has their gun you can upgrade, evolve into a more powerful version, and then choose between two even more powerful versions, and also two abilities, which when you put them at max level there's nothing left to upgrade for that character. The only time I find myself making a choice is between the two different gun transformations, nothing else, because each time I level up I just upgrade something without thinking much. My suggestion would be to not only make a lot more characters, which I suppose they're already gonna do obviously, but also make them have more depth to them, make me consider each of my options when upgrading stuff, maybe create more skills for all characters but have them capped at two for each one so you don't have 50 abilities poppin' every few seconds which would make the game a cakewalk, and would force you to actually choose between different skills and test different combinations of skills with each character and in different squad combinations. And also other than that, of course the game needs more content in general.
Anyways I think this game has a lot of potential, looking forward to the new updates, keep up the good work!

It's pretty good, 7/10. The only major innovation here is 3D, [b]but being in 3D does have a huge impact[/b]. Everything feels crunchier. It feels like an AAA treatment of the horde survival genre.

The 3-team squad thing is pretty cool but it's just a way to lock in your weapon and special ability choices. Ultimately, if you've played a lot of horde survival games, the gameplay loop will be pretty familiar.

After around 5 hours (including time with the demo), I felt like I'd seen most of what the game offers. I could play for longer and grind out the meta progression, but there's not much else to do yet. So personally I think that it's worth the $10 asking price, considering other finished games in the same genre go for half that and have a lot more content (eg. Time Wasters). I also wonder if they're scaring off fans of the genre with the higher cost.

That said, I've enjoyed my time with it overall, and I've played and LOVED another game by this dev ([url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/465200/Fury_Unleashed/]Fury Unleashed[/url]), which is bursting with creativity. So I believe in the developers, and I'm sure what's on offer so far is just a taste of things to come. I've seen a lot of EA games go from basic to outstanding, and this could turn out to be another one of those. Just keep in mind that your purchase now might be more of a long-term investment than an immediate payoff.

HOWEVER.....game is a lot faster than VS early in the fight.

And for Early Access:
- UI lacks information 
- Your own skills lack information
- You cant check your skills and weapons beyond in-game selection leveling up
- Balancing issues - some upgrades are worse than previous guns, some skills are almost pointless
- Good performance - lags FPS (as all massive bullet hells do), but doesnt cook my GPU while standing in an open room

All and all - good VS-clone with gimmick of guns. Updates probably will make it even better.

If you like swords, there's a sword guy, machine guns? Yea, there's a a few, including a minigun. Rockets for max zombie pile? Oh, yeah, there's a rocket launcher upgrade for one of the characters but there's also air strikes, bombing runs, explosive arrows and freaking mines! You want to recreate vietnam in the zompocalypse? GO FOR IT! Even the medic, yes there's a medic, has a gun upgrade that turns dead things that want to hurt you into purple mist and flying bodies, hot dam! I love this game and I can't wait to see what the devs are cooking up next. Only downside is that it is EA so the content is a little light right now but it's still a solid game as is.

Not a bad game. It is another VS-like bullet hell game with zombie twist - and it does it decently. It is still in its early access, so the features are limited, but I am looking forward to the updates. It takes about 10-15 hours to 100% complete.

This one really stands out from all the vampire survivor clones you'll find these days.
Tying the abilities to different characters that can form a party is a unique and interesting twist, while still keeping the option to do solo runs to see how far you can push each run and strategy is really addicting.
Making item upgrades that drop on the map separate from level ups is also a fun design choice.

Very excited to see what the future holds and what the devs can cook up!
This is fun to play!

Plays just how I wanted a survivors to play like. Also, I wanted one that's 3D and all the other ones felt "meh" including - yes I'm afraid to say so - Soulstone. Which I recall as "too colorful, too bright". Felt like a kid's game to be honest. And the only mentionable other one ... can't recall but you were playing a Mech and that felt kind of .. anonymous, and lackluster implementation.

Not so Yet Another ... funny that it had to be "another" one that seems to get it right. :)

I like how the mobs are animated characters with ragdolls so it feels satisfying slicing through them. It gives you that sense of accomplishment and power and satisfaction I like in a shooter. 

I like how the items stand out, how I can always see my character(s) and differentiate between them, the mobs, and the mayhem of particles and projectiles. 

I like the fact that you can combine up to three characters - or just go solo for a different challenge. I like the speed and agility you can play this game as well as the diversity you get from going with different characters and upgrade paths. 

I like how you feel more powerful over time and the difficulty curve seems well balanced - and once you think you can't ever not complete a run is where you should try endless or hardcore mode to put your current level of abilities into perspective.

I also like to have played through the entire game as is, with almost all achievements and all training perks done - and I can still look forward to three more characters, a third upgrade level for each character, and new "maps". Although map is overstating it, let's call it "background graphics" really. ;)

Looking forward to future updates!
So much fun I can not wait for more things to be added and I like all the little references to other games that are like it especially Vampire Survivors.

This is early access - I've been playing a ton of bullet hell games recently so I decided to give this one a try. The concept is interesting but the content is pretty limited. The power-up tree feels incredibly cookie cutter and doesn't really unlock any new styles of gameplay, it just makes future runs a little easier. The default level ends after 20 min, the endless mode is like a hyper version of default except with worse rewards. Each character has a 'level up' system that unlocks deeper weapon upgrades after killing X amount of monsters.

This game went early access too soon IMO. After 4 hours I've already unlocked 60% of the achievements and I could probably unlock everything sub 10 hours if I weren't already bored of it. Not worth the $10 when there are other games in this genre at that price that are fully formed and have a strong depth of gameplay, powerups and variability.

Overall - great game.  I really like how they implemented a party system, whereby you start with one character with a specific set of abilities, but can build your own comp based on rescuing other class types.

Yes, it's EA.  Yes, it needs a lot more content, but the overall gameplay is solid.  I didn't really encounter any bugs at all playing the game.  I feel like once the additional content gets released, this will be a super fun game to play through the rest of the content.

You basically have two types of damage - weapon and skill dmg.  I feel like this needs some tuning, as the skill damage tends to be FAR less than weapon damage.  In these types of games, you typically move constantly, and some of the skills place a turret or something on the ground, and they tend to do very little damage as you move offscreen from them as compared to other skills. 

It's fun to create a comp that just wrecks everything, but also fun to build a really solid survival comp.

The Steam Deck has rekindled my love in reverse bullet hell and twin-stick shooters. Vampire Survivors, Army of Ruin, Twenty Minutes to Dawn.. and now Yet Another Zombie Survivors. 

Awesome Game Studios did a great job of differentiating YAZS from its brethren by adding key features:

1. You are not solo. Instead, you get to "rescue" up to two other survivors to add their weapons and abilities to your attempt.
2. These other survivors come with their own abilities that are unlocked with play as with any roguelike. They are different enough from the other classes - medic, tank, SWAT, ghost, huntress, and engineer - to make each play thru a challenge, 
3. The abilities that are unlocked separate from the classes are adjustable before each run, making the combo of party, weapon tree choice, and abilities extremely customizable.
4. The graphics are quite good for a RBH game.  

I've played on the Steam Deck and on my PC with a controller, and it's a blast. It is surprisingly addictive. Highly recommended. I have more than got my money's worth, and there's still more to come!

At the time of this comment I think it's well worth the price. The way it breaks up progression is really nice. You unlock stuff per class when it's your primary pick but you still gain bonuses from up to 2 other survivors so you can really mix and match what you build into. Plus you are able to add and subtract meta points you earn for future runs to try different builds even more. Like some perks in the meta menu for future runs effect reload speeds or shooting speeds, while others effect cooldowns similar. There is also a wide variety. If you're on the fence take a gander on YouTube and you'll understand what makes this a gem thus far.

It would be nice to some kind of rough roadmap or teasers of what's on the docket even if there aren't dates set so the audience gets an idea of what's to come in some way next.

I originally could not recommend this game but after some time I found out I was comparing it to games like Vampire Survivors and Halls of Torment and it should be rated by how it plays by itself and not as a possible clone/copy of said games which it is not. 

Some things to keep in mind.
- Having to stop and wait to pick up survivors or upgrade caches. It annoyed me to no end but now I see it as an added challenge to do while being swarmed. I still think it needs to drop in time every so slightly though because it still feels a little TOO long.
- Not being able to direct your groups firing direction. This makes it extremely hard to clear lanes to escape through or to open up to get items. I prefer to direct my groups/characters attacks otherwise it is just one of those useless idle games but I decided to think of it as a challenge mechanic where if you want to clear a lane you get close to the zombies you want to clear since proximity takes priority unless a boss is around.
- The priority targeting. Your group targets Bosses above all else even if it is not the closest enemy which gets your group hit more times than not. Should've either allowed us to pick our priority targets or defaulted to closest enemy since we cannot control our groups firing direction. This is a flaw in the game that needs work IMO.
- Weapons missing target. I did not like it at first but grew to accept it. I could do without it TBH though.

BUGS:
- Bosses appearing with no health bar so have to guess.
- The bosses that charge not orienting correctly and facing opposite direction and so does their charge arrows even though they ultimately end up charging you like normal.
- Boss bar staying just below my characters even after it had died for the entire play through.
- Enemies appearing outside of map that can fire at you but you can't fire at them.
- Skills like mines appearing outside map so do absolutely no good.
- Had level up screen not freeze game like it should and got hit while my skill choice screen was up.

In it's current state (BUILD 0.2.2.):

-- the game looks good
-- it's fun to play
-- it has about 15 hours of gameplay for completionists
-- it has an endless mode for those who like to tinker with builds and compete for longest runs
-- the music is grand
-- writers did a good job with in-game item names and descriptions

The game lacks:
-- content (maps, characters, modes)
-- the sound design is sub-par at certain points (some weapon audio effects sound pretty cheap, like the SWAT's assault riffle)
-- there's a little too much grind to unlock certain characters (especially the medic)
-- the game could benefit from "change saves" option
-- it's doubtful that in it's current state YAZS is worth 10$.

That being said, what is here is fun and addictive, and I do recommend you give it a try, if you can part with 10 bucks.

this game plays 1:1 the same doesnt matter what level of the skilltree u have or what character you are playing or what weapon you currently have equipped

Took me 13h to complete the game including all achievments and all the meta progression.

My thoughts:

I am giving this a good review because the game has potential and I don't want to screw the dev with a bad review, considering this game in in early alfa. This might change if the price and content stays the same on the 1.0 version. If you don't want to support the development of this game don't buy it. It is not worth the price in its current state. Brotato for example is half of the price and it is a much more complete and fun game. Project Lazarus is prety much the same game with robots and aliens instead of zombies, and it is also cheaper and more complete, just giving too examples to prove the point.

About the game:

The game is another vampire survivors clone, brings absolutely nothing new to the table, that being said it is a good bullet hell game, the problem is that it really lacks content. There is only one map, 6 characters, each with 3 skills and 4 diffent weapons, enemy variety is 4 types of standard zombies and 3 types of elites and that is all. Considering that it takes between 10-45 minutes to complete, depending of the mode you choose, It does get repetitive very, very fast.

The only "special" thing this game does is that you can complete the session with up to 3 characters, but in reality they work as one entity so all you are doing is selecting the skills you want to use. Everything else is as standard as it gets.

Conclusion:

There is not much else to say. Bullet hells are simple "toilet" games, this one is no different, just another vampire survivors clone with 3D graphics and a zombie theme. Nothing more, nothing less. The problem is that it is a little bit expensive for the game it is.
I find mowing down hordes of zombies to be very relaxing...  bang bang ohm.......
Fun, needs more content like everyone including the dev has mentioned. Different team combos is nice, when content is added this game could go from a 6/10 to 8/10 easy.

I just had a blast playing YAZS! As a big fan of gaming, I'm always on the lookout for immersive experiences, and YAZS really hit the mark.

One of the coolest things about YAZS is the achievement system. It's well-designed,so far and going after those achievements added a whole new layer of fun to the game. I've spent hours exploring every corner of the game stage, trying to unlock every achievement, and it's been super satisfying.

The gameplay in YAZS is smooth as butter, and I found myself completely engrossed in the game world. The graphics are top-notch, and the gameplay kept me hooked from start to finish. You can tell the developers poured their hearts into creating this masterpiece.

What's even more exciting is the promise of more content on the horizon. I can't wait to see what else they have in store for YAZS. The potential for this game is through the roof, and I'm eagerly looking forward to new challenges and adventures.

Major props to the developers for their hard work and dedication. It's clear that they genuinely care about their players and delivering an incredible gaming experience. With such a strong foundation, I have no doubt that YAZS will only get better and better.

With its immersive gameplay and the excitement of future updates, it's a journey you won't want to miss. Thumbs up to the developers for creating something truly special!

Like many 'bullet hell' type games, this will be compared to Vampire Hunters. This is in early access at the moment and I have completed all available achievements as well as levelling all classes to max. Personally I find this to have so much potential as more content is added. I like, that the 'standard' mode of gameplay is to survive for 20 minutes. Great when you are levelling your classes and unlocking stuff. There is also a Hardcore mode, which is fast and furious, lasts 10 minutes but also an open ended mode to last as long as you can.
6 classes at the moment, including a tank and healer. I find it fun to mix these up and see what works well. Each class is different which is nice, so you can make an effort to be a little tactical, based upon your playstyle. One of the best games in this genre and I personally found it more 'let's just have one more game' than all of the others.
Definitely worth a try!
Yet Another Zombie Survivors

At time of writing this the game is in Early Access - It has only been out about two weeks. As such, the content is a bit sparse. There are six characters available (3 as standard and 3 you unlock) and only 1 map, with 3 game modes; Normal, Hardcore, and Endless. However, there are placeholder slots in the game for 'coming soon' content showing the potential for a lot more characters and maps. The Devs are also vocal on their discord, and they have taken in some of the feedback I have given and implemented it in the game, which is nice to see.

So what about the actual game? Honestly, it's amazingly fun. If you like the genre of a 'Bullet Heaven' style Roguelite, such as Vampire Survivors or Brotato, then you will probably like this too. The graphics are better, and it runs really well on the Steam Deck too (despite the current rating of unknown). FPS does drop on the Steam Deck, but if you turn the FPS counter off, it is hard to tell the FPS is dropping, for the most part and the Devs are working to make it run more optimised on the Deck.

I am excited to see and test out new content in the game when it releases, and there is a decent level of replay value available in the game. Currently I do have some issues with certain items/general balancing of stuff, but as it is Early Access and they are changing things and making improvements I am hopeful that these things will be fixed by the time the game releases officially. 

Overall, I highly recommend this game to anyone that likes the genre.

It's nice to see a rogue-like with good graphics. The game is fun and the classes are cool.

Notes for devs: (I know this is early in development, and the game is really fun)
1. Class balance
-- Engineer > everything else.
-- Is the Swat helicopter meant to do anything? it only appears to obfuscate the ground effects, with minimal damage
-- Medic makes the group significantly better in every situation
2. Weapons are fun, but it seems like the tiers aren't balanced against each other.
-- The tier 2 Engineer weapon is better than the upgrades, as the laser doesn't seem to hit enemies behind the target.
-- Swat sniper needs a buff
-- Bow's multishot upgrade feels awful since the arrows reset when you select ice/explosive, even the medic's syringe is more fun
3. Upgrades / Traits
-- Increasing damage by upgrading crit always seems to be the best choice since the +abilities and +attacks don't do enough. If you want people to choose between weapon damage vs abilities, the upgrades need to do more
-- Health upgrades are too low, and taking Medic fixes most issues
4. Add a minimap, please!
5. Why are the buffs fading so quickly?
6. New classes (random thoughts)
-- Trapper (cc, slows)
-- Brute (big hammer-type)
-- Assassin/poison-type?

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Passover in 2022 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I enjoyed this game as it was fun to figure out my own meta and then see how long I could survive.  It seemed as though the devs saw some videos recently showing a very strong meta in which self healing made it impossible to die.

It was pretty obvious that they realized maxxing out zombie damage at 300% was not the right call otherwise players would survive forever.  Unfortunately, this completely destroyed the willingness to play past 25 mins.  In addition to removing the damage cap, they sped up the zombies to the point where you can't possibly outrun the axe murderer guy because he swings the second he stops running.

I guess how else would you eventually kill us, considering we can level up heal per second past 30 and lifesteal at 5%. That, in combination with the engineer bubble is an unkillable combo.  However, at that point, you make the zombies so fast and so strong that at the 25-30 minute mark, we can't level at the same speed as them.

Basically up to 15 mins you're dominant and you can easily avoid any damage using the engineer bubble, tesla and any offensive duo.  At some point at 20 mins, you stop becoming powerful and the zombies start to level at a ridiculous rate.  Unless devs allow me to upgrade alongside the zombies allowing me to continue to be stronger, I'll never make any progress.

The most engaging "Survivors" genre game I've played to-date.

The genre is typified by spending most of your time just moving around the map, collecting stuff and trying not to get hit (re. bullet-hell, sorta).  If you're unfamiliar with it, it can sound boring - and for some of the games available, it is.  However, the best in the genre blend strategy with tension and several upgrade trees (re. rogue-lite) to yield something that keeps you coming back for more.  YEZS has done this, as well as improved the entertainment factor.

Here, you play one of several unlockable classes, and during a map, you can rescue (so far) up to two more of the available classes to give yourself a 3-person squad.  That squad spends its time gathering upgrades (good only for that gaming session), as well as money which can be used to permanently improve your squad's stats (good for every game you play).

I'm not sure why I'm not burnt out on the zombie idiom yet, but here it's fun, and adds to this game's ability to stand out from the pack (IMHO).  There are loads of different kinds of zombies: shamblers, poison spewers / poolers, sprinters, wasp sprayers, and several kinds of elites.  The graphics here are better than average for the genre too, and include rag-doll physics for the models, which is a nice touch.

Most of the survivors games I've played end up filling up the screen with mobs; this can make the game more tense, which is obviously a good thing.  I haven't seen that with YAZS yet - but instead it shrinks your of field of view.  With stuff sprinting at you from off-screen, this definitely creates a very familiar "zombie tension" - and in my experience is relatively new to the genre.  It works well with the other game features.

In short, this game is keeping me engaged more than almost all of the rest of the Survivors games I've played, and gets a solid recommendation from me.

Oh, and not to be rude, but some of the references are extremely cringe/outdated/overused: "over 9000", "barrel roll", "arrow to the knee", it feels like the devs typed "most popular internet memes" in google and took whatever first results showed up. It feels a bit... uninspired.

[h1]Way to early in development for a release.[/h1]
In short: I'm done with devs selling games with the promise of being good someday.

1) Like others said, it's extremly lacking in content. Only one map and of the nine survivors three are "coming soon". Oh, and the last level of the existing ones is also "coming soon". What [b]IS[/b] there got boring veeeeery fast. (There are enough games of this type out there with way more content for a lower price)
2) Performance is horrible. It struggles to stay over 100 fps at 1440p, while the utilization of the CPU always stays between 10 and 20% and GPU [b]never[/b] even reaches 50%. It's way worse on Steam Deck (but i dont consider that for my recommendation, since the game is not marketed for it). Barely over 20 fps later in the 20 minutes round while utilization of CPU and GPU always stays around 35%.
3) Balancing is horrible, too. That's not that big of a deal because it can be fixed easily with feedback of the players. Makes this point the only one i would consider a good point [b]for[/b] the early access release.

After all this game gives me the feeling the devs just put some bought assets from the Unity-Store together to make some quick money. Make a handfull of half-hearted updates in the future and abandon it. [b]Most likely that is not the case (it's not a new studio and they have already published some games)[/b], but that happend so often with early acces games here on Steam that i can't ignore that feeling. I hope i'm proven wrong in the future (and i will change this review then), but right now i can not recommend buying that game.

A fun take on the formula popularized recently by Vampire Survivors. 
Gameplay is satisfying and addictive, but the level of content is extremely lacking. 
One game mode, one map and a few characters. 

I know it's early access so this is to be somewhat expected, but I would have liked to see the content fleshed out more before release rather then a minimum viable product. After completing the first level (surviving for 20 min) there's not much else to do.

Disappointing because what's on offer here is fun, it's just a shell of a game at the moment.

Would not currently recommend with this level of content but will update when there's fewer coming soon text boxes.

For the most part you start with character you want to level up and then just go straight for ghost/assault combo. Most of the additional weapons are shit - everything other than main weapons and buffs are typically not worth leveling. Classes are unbalanced and mostly boring, uninspired, and they just don't have that 'something' that makes you like them. The survival mode ramps up the enemy speed to a point where they just blink on the screen and you're one shot. There are 4 types of basic enemies - slow zombies, fast zombies, zombies that explode when killed and spitters + 3 elite monsters - one that charges at you, one that chargges at you but with axe and one that does not charge at you, which is fine as far as vampire survivors clone go.

UX is really bad - you have no idea what weapons do unless you test them yourself, there are no tooltips and no info on (for example) that medic's 2nd tier weapon poisons the enemies and if they die under the influence of the poison they explone and infect other around (its super weak tho, dont get excited)

Worst of all - no content. If you believe what you see on the menu's theres like 5% content available right now. But there's literally nothing - a single level where you just keep unlocking stuff that for the most part makes your character weaker - like the final kunai weapon for ghost just makes it harder to level up the thousand cuts. No real bosses, no 'hidden' content like in Vamp survivors, nothing.

Lastly since there are a lot of people who dont care about this - graphics are really bad. Not just the quality of the models - they are fine i guess - but the lighting setup, post processing etc. - it's just really BAD.

Why did i play this game for 7 hours then? I was really bored, wanted to check out the characters/weapons and to get my money's worth.

If you liked Vampire Survivors, or if you liked Brotato, You'll probably enjoy the hell out of Yet Another Zombie Survivors. 

The graphics are great, sounds are great as well. For being an early access game, I'm seriously hooked already, and have only run across some minor UI glitches. (Nothing game breaking)  In the hand full of days that I've had this game, it's already been updated by the developers, signaling to me that this game is well loved, and supported by it's dev team. 

Game play wise, there's only one map, but slots in the UI for more.  But even with that, I'm not bored with the game, and am thoroughly hooked in the game play loop.  Just today, I discovered that you could actually survive to see dawn, and complete a run without having to die.   Yes, I know, it's probably written somewhere that this is a goal, but I'm the type of person who dives in head first, and plays to discover the rules of the game as I go. 

So far, I've gotten 5 of the characters unlocked, and have only been focusing advancing the first character as a team leader.  I still have several team members to unlock, and there are more slots for future additions. 

As of yet, there are no visible monetization hooks in the game, and hopefully the game will remain this way.
So far it is a lot of fun.. still early so there is much yet to come .. but i have great hopes and am already having fun with this one.

tl;dr - A fun "Vampire Survivors"-like game. There's not much content yet, but what it does have is enjoyable. If it looks good to you, don't bother with any other reviews and just buy it. And if you hate it, blame me for telling you to buy it and then get a refund. If you're looking for manual aim, keep waiting and I'll update once it's out.

Update time:
Version 0.2.2 fixed a lot of bugs and directly addressed issues that the community has brought up INCLUDING AUTO AIM.

So obviously I'm gonna talk about auto aim. 
Previously, the auto aim was so incredibly bad that I advised ignoring the game unless you're a hardcore "survivors" nerd. 
It's not fully fixed, there's still some wonky behavior with spread attacks like the Huntress' bow and the Tanks shotgun*, but it's good enough that I don't feel like certain characters are actually a handicap.

But look, at this point I'm just nitpicking. While not perfect, the auto aim is good enough that it no longer drags this game out of recommendation status and the developers quick response in solving these issues is a very good sign.

Still no manual aim though, devs say next update will have it so I'll update my review AGAIN once it's added. Maybe I should become a game journalist... I mean.... I can't be as bad as Polygon playing Doom or that one guy playing Cuphead...

NEW RECOMMENDATIONS! 
If you're looking for a lot of content or manual aim, keep waiting.
Everyone else, buy the game. It's pretty good.

* It kinda aims at the closest enemy, but then over a certain distance it seems to ignore the closest enemy and go for the attack that will hit the most enemies. Which sounds cool, but when you have explosive arrows it makes it harder to aim inside of a group of zombies instead of just at the ones in the front.
Also the character snaps between targets like the aimbot got turned 11 (which is probably exactly what happened).

---

tl;dr - Lots of potential, but poor quality auto aim really ruins the feel of the characters. I don't recommend the game to the casual player, but if you're a hardcore nerd for these "Vampire Survivor"-like games then it's cheap enough that you won't feel ripped off by what it has right now.

Pros:
- Diverse characters
- 3 man squads are novel and a cool way to add variety to a run
- Continuously spawning equipment makes runs more varied while also giving you a reason to run around
- Continuously spawning survivors is a really cool way to get levels as the exp needs increase
- Boss characters have different mechanics
- Endless & Hardcore modes
- Characters can "level up" and unlock better weapons and new skills permanently.

Cons:
- Sound design on the weapons is hit or miss. The minigun sounds great, but the sniper sounds terrible. etc...
- Permanent upgrades don't feel impactful.
- FREAKING AUTO AIM SUCKS (I'll go into more detail on this one later)
- General lack of content (it's early access so I personally don't count this one, but it's still true)

Bugs I've seen:
- Sometimes a boss will spawn without a health bar and you kill it and it's health bar will appear just somewhere on the map and never leave that spot.
- Charger boss has a line indicating where it will charge, that line is worthless because the boss will immediately change direction to charge at you once it starts the charge. Even if it would be physically impossible for it to do so.
- Swarm boss scream is often out of sync and will sometimes just go off well after the boss has died.

Overall, it's a fun game with a DESPERATE need for an auto aim toggle. I'm going to rant about auto aim now.
Certain characters (huntress especially) are just absolutely nerfed by how horrendous the auto aim is. 
There's nothing quite as upsetting as maxing out your bow so it fires 4 explosive arrows at a time and then having the auto aim completely whiff 90% of the shots it takes because it doesn't understand the concept of leading your shots. You essentially have to stop moving to allow the character to shoot if you want to be sure you'll hit, and even then the auto aim accuracy only increases to about 80%. 
It's bad. It's so bad that it makes certain characters feel bad to use.
If you couple that with the very low impact that the permanent upgrades have on each run the game gets very boring very quickly.

I have 2 recommendations:
1. If you're a casual player that saw a new game and came here. Don't buy it. It's not worth your time and money as it is currently. Come check again in like 2 months, if the issues have been fixed by then my review will be updated.
2. If you're a hardcore "Vampire Survivors" nerd looking for your next fix, check out "Halls of Torment" and "Soulstone Survivors" first and then come back and get this game.

Another good addition to the survivor genre. Y.A.Z.S is a V-Survivor-esque auto-shooter in the form of S.W.A.T vs zombie and it works really well. This game has the typical grind-set in mind with an extensive skill tree to upgrade and multiple characters to unlock. The graphics are nice. I played on PC and on Deck, and although good on both the frame rate suffered a bit on Deck at this point in time averaging 25fps. You control a squad of 3 soldiers, all having unique weapons and skills. This works well in single player but I REALLY wish a coop was incorporated. 3 player coop would make this game fantastic and I instantly thought this during my first run.

And it worked! Out of the 22 hours played as of this post, 20 of those were done in the first 2 days I owned the game. My life went from being completely empty to full of (digital pixel) meaning. I found a community full of people who I didn't share a language with, but yet who would post to the Steam forums desperately trying to beat the 'It's Raining Men" achievement.

And we mostly all persevered. Pay the $8 for the game. Yes, it does cost more than Vampire Survivors. Yes, it is in VERY EARLY ACCESS. Who TF cares? It's already fun, the devs are amazingly responsive to almost every post in the forums, and they seem dedicated to making this into a great game as their work continues. I can't wait to see where this game goes next!

The current content is so fun, can't wait to see what other content is to come!

It took me 32 hours to finish the current early access version (July '23), i.e.: team fully upgraded (level 90), all six available team leaders at current maximum rank 2, all 40 Steam achievements completed. All of that was good fun. While obviously repetitive (currently just one map with a limited variety of enemies) it never got boring. I am no pro gamer, and did not grind particularly hard - but I think everybody will get at least 20 hours of play out of the game as is. 

I encountered no serious bugs, about the worst was the game not re-pausing when getting another reward while in a reward choice screen. There are a few minor visual glitches now and then (rubber-stretched entities), but too infrequent to disrupt play. The 40 Steam achievements were all good skill tests well in line with game play - except for "It's raining men". That one currently is dumb, because it does not work if you are levelled up (you do too much damage). However, even there the game has a saving grace: you can actually downgrade, do the achievement, and upgrade again at no cost.

Balance is already surprisingly good, with none of the leaders being much worse or a lot better than the others, in spite of significantly different abilities. For example, I have solo'ed default mode with all six currently available leaders (yes, even with the Medic... though that's more a test of kiting ability). 

Hardcore mode is significantly more challenging to complete than default mode, even though one only needs to survive 10 minutes rather than 20, and endless mode will kill you eventually (or at least I have not managed to create an "endless" team where I stop out of boredom rather than because of dying).

By virtue of what is visible already in game, we should expect the following new things to come in the game in future: three new leaders (not yet named), rank three for all leaders, and four additional maps of which one is already names ("Green Hell", presumably a jungle map). 

All in all, I would definitely recommend picking this up, certainly at the current discounted price. It's a good entry into the genre and already in good technical shape in spite of being early access.

Had a blast with this game! no-lifed it 12 hrs today right after purchase and completed almost everything available. I cant wait to see where they take it. Needs a lot of tuning and the medic needs reworked or what I would prefer just completely replaced as the archetype doesn't really make sense for the game but the other playable characters are quite fun. Crit needs major reworking for sure as Swat+Ghost+Huntress with super high crit and crit damage just steamrolls any other possible comp because the auto attack weapons are around 1k dps each and any ability based build cant even come close to that (a swat + engineer + huntress turret build with really good cdr is not half bad though)  A few of the weapon upgrades are straight up nerfs to the previous versions (for example the multishot 2nd tier bow being better than the exploding/frost version) but that is all stuff I am sure they will sort out with time. 10/10 fun affordable game I hope Asmon gives it a shot and it blows up like Halls of Torment did!

I love these games and this is a great edition to the genre. I'm definitely going to be piling on the play time here. 

The only thing I could comment on is that all your items are pre-chosen, so it isn't like some other titles where you can get a large mix of items on every run and sometimes combine them into better things via upgrades/unlocks. Essentially each survivor has a weapon and 2 skills, so picking your team is everything. After that it's only buffs you will get opening crates.

I still really like the aspect of having a team and the 3D graphics are a great change up as well. I'll be following for updates~
